test_cases.Title: Validate Calculation of Total Credit Line (Day and Week)

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS with known credit line values.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed with credit line details.

Steps.Step Description: Identify the values for 'Fido Base Day', 'Estensione Day', 'Fido Base Week', and 'Estensione Week' for a Credit Line/Product.
Steps.Expected Result: Values for base and extension credit lines are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Fido Totale Day' equals 'Fido Base Day' + 'Estensione Day'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Fido Totale Day' is correctly calculated and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Fido Totale Week' equals 'Fido Base Week' + 'Estensione Week'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Fido Totale Week' is correctly calculated and displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with known credit line values exists in SIMP. User has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Calculation and display of total credit line values
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with 'Fido Base Day', 'Estensione Day', 'Fido Base Week', 'Estensione Week' values set in SIMP.
test_cases.Expected Result: Total credit line values are correctly calculated and displayed for both Day and Week.

test_cases.Title: Validate Calculation of Percentage of Credit Consumed (Day and Week)

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS with known consumption values.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed with consumption details.

Steps.Step Description: Identify the values for 'Consumato Day', 'Fido Totale Day', 'Consumato Week', and 'Fido Totale Week'.
Steps.Expected Result: Values for consumed and total credit lines are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that '% consumato Day' equals ('Consumato Day' / 'Fido Totale Day') * 100.
Steps.Expected Result: '% consumato Day' is correctly calculated and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that '% consumato Week' equals ('Consumato Week' / 'Fido Totale Week') * 100.
Steps.Expected Result: '% consumato Week' is correctly calculated and displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with known consumption and total credit line values exists in SIMP. User has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Calculation and display of percentage of credit consumed
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with 'Consumato Day', 'Fido Totale Day', 'Consumato Week', 'Fido Totale Week' values set in SIMP.
test_cases.Expected Result: Percentage of credit consumed is correctly calculated and displayed for both Day and Week.

test_cases.Title: Validate Calculation of Residual Credit Line (Day and Week)

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS with known residual values.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed with residual credit details.

Steps.Step Description: Identify the values for 'Fido Totale Day', 'Consumato Day', 'Fido Totale Week', and 'Consumato Week'.
Steps.Expected Result: Values for total and consumed credit lines are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Residuo Day' equals 'Fido Totale Day' - 'Consumato Day'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Residuo Day' is correctly calculated and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Residuo Week' equals 'Fido Totale Week' - 'Consumato Week'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Residuo Week' is correctly calculated and displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with known total and consumed credit line values exists in SIMP. User has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Calculation and display of residual credit line
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with 'Fido Totale Day', 'Consumato Day', 'Fido Totale Week', 'Consumato Week' values set in SIMP.
test_cases.Expected Result: Residual credit line is correctly calculated and displayed for both Day and Week.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Update Frequency is Near Real-Time

Steps.Step Description: Update a Credit Line/Product value (e.g., 'Fido Base Day') for a PoS in the SIMP system.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Line/Product value is updated in SIMP.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the affected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the updated value is reflected in the ZENIT Dashboard within the expected near real-time window (e.g., within 1 minute).
Steps.Expected Result: Updated value is visible in ZENIT Dashboard within the near real-time window.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to both SIMP and ZENIT systems. PoS with existing Credit Line/Product data.
test_cases.Functionality: Near real-time data synchronization between SIMP and ZENIT
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with modifiable Credit Line/Product data in SIMP.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT Dashboard reflects SIMP data changes within the near real-time update window.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Acquisition Fallback to DWH Replica

Steps.Step Description: Simulate SIMP system unavailability (e.g., disconnect or stop SIMP service).
Steps.Expected Result: SIMP system is unavailable.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Credit Lines/Products data is retrieved from the DWH replica and displayed correctly.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Lines/Products data is present and accurate, sourced from DWH replica.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH replica is available and contains up-to-date data. SIMP system is intentionally made unavailable. User has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Fallback data acquisition from DWH replica
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with Credit Line/Product data in DWH replica.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT retrieves and displays Credit Line/Product data from DWH replica when SIMP is unavailable.

test_cases.Title: Verify Handling of Missing or Incomplete Data from SIMP/DWH

Steps.Step Description: Configure SIMP or DWH to provide incomplete data for a PoS (e.g., missing 'Fido Base Day' or 'Consumato Day').
Steps.Expected Result: PoS data in SIMP/DWH is incomplete.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the affected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the system handles missing or incomplete data (e.g., displays a placeholder, error message, or leaves the field blank).
Steps.Expected Result: System handles missing/incomplete data gracefully, with appropriate indication to the user.

test_cases.Preconditions: SIMP or DWH contains incomplete data for at least one PoS. User has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with missing or incomplete Credit Line/Product data in SIMP/DWH.
test_cases.Expected Result: System displays missing/incomplete data fields appropriately without causing errors or misleading information.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Consistency Between SIMP and ZENIT

Steps.Step Description: Access the SIMP system and note the Credit Lines/Products data for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Lines/Products data is visible in SIMP.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the same PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Compare each field (Zona Code, RICE Number, Alias, Credit Lines/Products, Basic credit line, Credit line extension, Total credit line, Consumed credit line, Percentage of credit consumed, Residual credit line) between SIMP and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields in ZENIT match the corresponding values in SIMP (or DWH if SIMP is unavailable).

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with valid Credit Line/Product data exists in both SIMP and ZENIT. User has access to both systems.
test_cases.Functionality: Data consistency between SIMP and ZENIT
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known Credit Line/Product data in SIMP.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT displays data consistent with SIMP (or DWH) for all required fields.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Acquisition and Display for All Required Credit Line Fields (Day and Week)

Steps.Step Description: Ensure MST, SIMP, or DWH replica contains valid credit line data for a specific PoS (including all required fields for both Day and Week).
Steps.Expected Result: Source system(s) contain complete and valid data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for ZENIT to perform a data acquisition cycle (manual or scheduled).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT retrieves the latest data from the configured source.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads and displays credit line data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are displayed for both Day and Week: Zona Code, RICE Number, Credit Lines/Products, Fido Base, Estensione, Fido Totale, Consumato, % consumato, Residuo.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and populated with correct values for both Day and Week.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test PoS with complete credit line data exists in MST, SIMP, or DWH. ZENIT is configured to retrieve from the correct source. User has access to the Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Data acquisition and display of MST Credit Lines/Products for PoS
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known credit line data for both Day and Week; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: All required credit line fields for both Day and Week are correctly acquired and displayed for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Correct Calculation of Total, Percentage Consumed, and Residual Credit Lines (Day and Week)

Steps.Step Description: Prepare MST, SIMP, or DWH with a PoS having known values for Fido Base Day, Estensione Day, Consumato Day, Fido Base Week, Estensione Week, Consumato Week.
Steps.Expected Result: Source system(s) contain the specified values for the test PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for ZENIT to acquire the data.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT retrieves the latest data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the credit line data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Fido Totale Day' is equal to 'Fido Base Day' + 'Estensione Day'.
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed 'Fido Totale Day' matches the calculated value.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that '% consumato Day' is equal to ('Consumato Day' / 'Fido Totale Day') * 100.
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed '% consumato Day' matches the calculated value.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Residuo Day' is equal to 'Fido Totale Day' - 'Consumato Day'.
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed 'Residuo Day' matches the calculated value.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 4-6 for Week values ('Fido Totale Week', '% consumato Week', 'Residuo Week').
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed Week values match the calculated values.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test PoS with known, controlled credit line values in the source system. ZENIT is operational and configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Calculation and display of derived credit line fields
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with specific test values for Fido Base, Estensione, Consumato (Day and Week); valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: All calculated fields (Total, Percentage Consumed, Residual) are correctly computed and displayed for both Day and Week.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Acquisition Frequency and Near Real-Time Update Behavior

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS with existing credit line data in the source system (MST/SIMP/DWH).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS exists with valid data.

Steps.Step Description: Update one or more credit line fields (e.g., Consumato Day) in the source system for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Source system reflects the updated value.

Steps.Step Description: Record the time of the update in the source system.
Steps.Expected Result: Update timestamp is noted.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor ZENIT Dashboard for the PoS in the 'Credit Management' tab and record when the updated value appears.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard reflects the updated value after a short interval.

Steps.Step Description: Calculate the elapsed time between the source update and Dashboard update.
Steps.Expected Result: Elapsed time is within the defined near real-time threshold (as per system specification or SLA).

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with updatable data in the source system. ZENIT is running and connected. User has Dashboard access.
test_cases.Functionality: Near real-time data acquisition and update propagation
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with modifiable credit line data; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard reflects source data changes within the expected near real-time window.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not verify exact polling/refresh mechanism, only end-to-end update propagation.

test_cases.Title: Verify Handling of Missing or Incomplete Data from Source Systems

Steps.Step Description: Configure the source system (MST/SIMP/DWH) so that one or more required fields (e.g., Estensione Day) are missing or null for a test PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Source system contains incomplete data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for ZENIT to acquire data for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to retrieve and process the incomplete data.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads and displays available data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the Dashboard displays missing or null fields (e.g., empty, zero, error message, or placeholder).
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard handles missing data gracefully, following UI/UX guidelines (e.g., shows empty field, placeholder, or appropriate error message).

test_cases.Preconditions: Test PoS with incomplete data in the source system. ZENIT is operational. User has Dashboard access.
test_cases.Functionality: Robustness to incomplete or missing data during acquisition and display
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with intentionally missing/null fields in the source system; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays missing or incomplete data in a user-friendly and robust manner, without errors or crashes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover all possible missing field combinations.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Acquisition from Alternative Sources (MST, SIMP, DWH)

Steps.Step Description: Configure ZENIT to acquire data from MST as the primary source. Ensure test PoS data is present in MST.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT is set to use MST and can access PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger data acquisition and verify data is displayed correctly in the Dashboard for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays correct data from MST.

Steps.Step Description: Switch ZENIT configuration to use SIMP as the data source. Ensure test PoS data is present in SIMP.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT is set to use SIMP and can access PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger data acquisition and verify data is displayed correctly in the Dashboard for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays correct data from SIMP.

Steps.Step Description: Switch ZENIT configuration to use DWH replica as the data source. Ensure test PoS data is present in DWH.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT is set to use DWH and can access PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger data acquisition and verify data is displayed correctly in the Dashboard for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays correct data from DWH.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test PoS data is present and consistent in all three source systems. ZENIT supports source switching. User has Dashboard access.
test_cases.Functionality: Data acquisition from multiple possible sources
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with identical data in MST, SIMP, and DWH; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT correctly acquires and displays data from each configured source system.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not test source system failures or inconsistencies.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Behavior When Source System is Unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Simulate unavailability of the configured source system (e.g., MST is offline or unreachable).
Steps.Expected Result: Source system is not accessible by ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for ZENIT to attempt data acquisition for a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to connect to the source system and fails.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads or attempts to load data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the Dashboard and ZENIT handle the failure (e.g., error message, retry logic, fallback, or user notification).
Steps.Expected Result: System handles source unavailability gracefully, providing clear feedback to the user and avoiding crashes or data corruption.

test_cases.Preconditions: Configured source system can be made unavailable. ZENIT is operational. User has Dashboard access.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for source system unavailability
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with data in the (now unavailable) source system; valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: System provides clear, user-friendly error handling when the source system is unavailable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not verify automatic failover or recovery mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Automated Data Acquisition from COMMA6 to ZENIT

Steps.Step Description: Ensure COMMA6 system contains up-to-date AWP data for all PoS as of the previous evening.
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 system has the latest data available for extraction.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily integration job between COMMA6 and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration job executes without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Access ZENIT system and verify that new data for each PoS is present for the current day (snapshot of previous evening).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains a new daily snapshot for each PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: COMMA6 and ZENIT systems are operational and connected. Daily integration job is scheduled and enabled.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated daily data acquisition and integration
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data in COMMA6 for at least two PoS with all required fields populated.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system receives and stores a daily snapshot of AWP data for each PoS from COMMA6, reflecting the previous evening's data.

test_cases.Title: Validate Correctness and Completeness of Transferred PoS Data Fields

Steps.Step Description: In COMMA6, prepare PoS records with known values for all required fields (IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr AWP Management IAG, Nr AWP Management NO IAG, Nr AWP Third-party IAG, Nr AWP Third-partyNO IAG, Nr AWP Average, Type of Collection AWP under Management, Coin In Average AWP - YTD).
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 contains PoS records with controlled test data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily integration job to run.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration job completes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: In ZENIT, access the daily snapshot for each PoS and compare each field value with the source data in COMMA6.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields in ZENIT match the corresponding values in COMMA6 for each PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test PoS data with known values is present in COMMA6. Integration job is scheduled.
test_cases.Functionality: Data field mapping and transfer accuracy
test_cases.Dataset: PoS records in COMMA6 with explicit values for all required fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: All required PoS data fields are accurately and completely transferred from COMMA6 to ZENIT for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Data Storage and Historical Retention in ZENIT

Steps.Step Description: Ensure ZENIT has received daily data snapshots for at least three consecutive days.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains at least three daily snapshots per PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the historical data for a selected PoS in ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical daily snapshots are available for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each day's snapshot reflects the correct data as per the corresponding day's COMMA6 data.
Steps.Expected Result: Each snapshot matches the source data for its respective day.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT has been running daily integrations for at least three days. Historical data is not purged.
test_cases.Dataset: Three days of PoS data in COMMA6 and corresponding snapshots in ZENIT.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT stores and retains daily snapshots for each PoS, allowing historical analysis.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Display of Daily PoS Data in Single PoS and ADI Data Tab

Steps.Step Description: After daily integration, log in to ZENIT and navigate to the Dashboard - Single PoS for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all required data fields (as per requirement) are displayed with correct values for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields are present and values match the latest daily snapshot.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ADI Data Tab for the same PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ADI Data Tab loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the same data fields are displayed and consistent with the Single PoS view.
Steps.Expected Result: Data fields and values are consistent across both views.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT contains at least one daily snapshot for the selected PoS. User has access to Dashboard and ADI Data Tab.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known daily snapshot data in ZENIT.
test_cases.Expected Result: All required PoS data fields are correctly displayed in both the Single PoS Dashboard and ADI Data Tab, matching the latest daily snapshot.

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Handle Missing or Incomplete Data from COMMA6

Steps.Step Description: In COMMA6, create a PoS record with one or more required fields missing or set to null.
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 contains a PoS record with incomplete data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily integration job to run.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration job processes the record.

Steps.Step Description: Check ZENIT for the corresponding PoS snapshot.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT either flags the record as incomplete, logs an error, or handles the missing data according to system design (e.g., default values, error messages).

test_cases.Preconditions: Integration job is scheduled. COMMA6 contains at least one PoS record with missing data.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record in COMMA6 with missing required fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT handles missing or incomplete data gracefully, according to system requirements (e.g., error logging, default values, or user notification).

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Verify System Behavior When COMMA6 is Unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Simulate COMMA6 system downtime during the scheduled daily integration window.
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 is unreachable by ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily integration job to run.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration job attempts to connect to COMMA6 and fails.

Steps.Step Description: Check ZENIT system logs and error notifications.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT logs the failure and notifies relevant stakeholders according to system design.

test_cases.Preconditions: Integration job is scheduled. Mechanism to simulate COMMA6 downtime is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for source system unavailability
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (simulate COMMA6 downtime).
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT detects COMMA6 unavailability, logs the error, and notifies stakeholders as per requirements.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Automated Data Acquisition from NEXT VLT to ZENIT

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the integration between ZENIT and NEXT VLT is configured and operational.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration is active and ready for data exchange.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily data acquisition process to run (at the expected time).
Steps.Expected Result: Data acquisition process initiates automatically without manual intervention.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the data transfer logs or dashboard for completion status.
Steps.Expected Result: Data transfer completes successfully with no errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and NEXT VLT systems are integrated and both systems are operational. Test environment contains at least one PoS with valid data.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated daily data acquisition and integration
test_cases.Dataset: At least one PoS with IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, and Nr VLT Average data available in NEXT VLT.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system automatically acquires and stores the previous day's VLT data for all PoS from NEXT VLT on a daily basis.

test_cases.Title: Validate Correctness of Acquired Data Fields for Each PoS

Steps.Step Description: After daily acquisition, access the ZENIT database or dashboard for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Data for the selected PoS is available for the previous day.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are present and populated: IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and not null.

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the values of these fields with the source data in NEXT VLT for the same PoS and date.
Steps.Expected Result: Values in ZENIT match exactly with those in NEXT VLT for the reference date.

test_cases.Preconditions: Successful daily data acquisition has occurred. Access to both ZENIT and NEXT VLT data for the same PoS and date.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS with known IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, and Nr VLT Average values in NEXT VLT.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT displays all required fields for each PoS, and values are accurate and consistent with NEXT VLT.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Availability in Dashboard - Single PoS View

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with access to PoS data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a PoS for which data was acquired in the last daily update.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS details are loaded.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the latest daily data (IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average) is displayed for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and reflect the latest daily snapshot.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one daily data acquisition has been completed. User credentials with dashboard access.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with recent data acquisition.
test_cases.Expected Result: The Single PoS dashboard displays the most recent daily data for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Availability in Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with access to PoS data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS' section and select a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard view is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'ADI Data' tab within the Single PoS dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: ADI Data tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the latest daily data (IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average) is displayed in the ADI Data tab.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and reflect the latest daily snapshot.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one daily data acquisition has been completed. User credentials with dashboard access.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with recent data acquisition.
test_cases.Expected Result: The ADI Data tab displays the most recent daily data for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Behavior When No Data is Available for a PoS

Steps.Step Description: Ensure there is a PoS in ZENIT for which no data has been acquired from NEXT VLT (e.g., new PoS or data acquisition failed).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS exists in ZENIT with no associated daily data.

Steps.Step Description: Access the dashboard and navigate to the Single PoS view for this PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads the PoS details.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the data fields (IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average) for this PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a clear message or indicator that no data is available for the selected date, and fields are empty or marked as unavailable.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one PoS exists in ZENIT with no daily data acquired.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling and empty state management
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with no data in ZENIT for the reference date.
test_cases.Expected Result: System gracefully handles missing data by displaying an appropriate message or indicator in the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Storage and Historical Retention for Daily Acquisitions

Steps.Step Description: After several days of successful daily data acquisitions, access the ZENIT database or dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical data for multiple days is available.

Steps.Step Description: Select a PoS and review its data for several previous dates (e.g., last 7 days).
Steps.Expected Result: Data for each day is available and distinct.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the data for each date matches the corresponding snapshot from NEXT VLT for that day.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical data in ZENIT matches the source data for each date.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least 7 days of daily data acquisition have occurred. Access to historical data in both ZENIT and NEXT VLT.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with at least 7 days of data in both systems.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT retains and displays accurate historical daily data for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Handling of Data Acquisition Failure and Error Logging

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a failure in the data acquisition process (e.g., disconnect NEXT VLT or introduce invalid data).
Steps.Expected Result: Data acquisition process fails to complete.

Steps.Step Description: Check the ZENIT system logs or error dashboard for error messages related to the failure.
Steps.Expected Result: An appropriate error message is logged, indicating the cause of the failure.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no partial or corrupt data is stored in ZENIT for the affected PoS/date.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT does not store incomplete or invalid data for the failed acquisition.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to simulate data acquisition failure. Monitoring/logging enabled in ZENIT.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with simulated acquisition failure.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT logs the error and prevents storage of invalid or partial data for failed acquisitions.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Automated Data Acquisition from GESTORETE to ZENIT

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the integration between ZENIT and GESTORETE is active and configured for daily data acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration is active and scheduled for daily execution.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the scheduled daily acquisition time to pass (e.g., after midnight).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT initiates an automated data acquisition process from GESTORETE.

Steps.Step Description: Check ZENIT logs or monitoring tools for confirmation of successful data acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: Logs indicate successful data retrieval from GESTORETE for all PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and GESTORETE systems are operational and integration is configured for daily data acquisition.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated daily data acquisition and integration
test_cases.Dataset: Configured PoS data in GESTORETE for at least one ZonaRice.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT automatically acquires and stores daily data from GESTORETE for all PoS without manual intervention.

test_cases.Title: Verify Correctness of Acquired Data Fields for Each PoS

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily data acquisition from GESTORETE to ZENIT to complete.
Steps.Expected Result: Data acquisition process completes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for a specific ZonaRice.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are present and populated: ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and populated with data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Daily data acquisition has been completed for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: Known PoS with all fields populated in GESTORETE.
test_cases.Expected Result: All required data fields for each PoS are correctly acquired and displayed in ZENIT.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Snapshot Reflects Previous Evenings State

Steps.Step Description: Update a PoSs data in GESTORETE late in the evening (e.g., 23:00).
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE reflects the updated data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the daily acquisition to occur (e.g., after midnight).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT performs the daily data acquisition.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for the updated ZonaRice.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the data as it was in GESTORETE at the end of the previous day.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS data in GESTORETE is updated before the daily snapshot time.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known data changes in GESTORETE before snapshot time.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT displays the previous evenings data snapshot for each PoS after daily acquisition.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Storage for Each Daily Acquisition

Steps.Step Description: Allow daily data acquisition to run for at least two consecutive days.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT acquires and stores data for each day.

Steps.Step Description: Access historical data storage or audit logs in ZENIT for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical records are available for each days acquisition.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the stored data for each day to ensure they reflect the correct daily snapshots.
Steps.Expected Result: Each days data matches the snapshot from GESTORETE for that day.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT has performed daily acquisitions for at least two days.
test_cases.Functionality: Daily data storage and historical record keeping
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with varying data in GESTORETE across multiple days.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT stores and allows retrieval of daily snapshots for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Handling of Missing or Incomplete Data from GESTORETE

Steps.Step Description: Configure a PoS in GESTORETE with one or more required fields missing or empty.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE contains incomplete data for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily data acquisition process.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to acquire data from GESTORETE.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for the affected ZonaRice.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays missing or incomplete data appropriately (e.g., empty fields, error message, or warning indicator).

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one PoS in GESTORETE has missing or incomplete data.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with missing fields in GESTORETE.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT handles missing or incomplete data gracefully and informs the user appropriately.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard - Single PoS Displays All Required Data Fields

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for a known ZonaRice after daily acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads successfully for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are displayed: ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and correctly labeled.

test_cases.Preconditions: Daily data acquisition has completed successfully.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with all fields populated in GESTORETE.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS displays all required fields for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab Displays All Required Data Fields

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab for a known ZonaRice after daily acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: ADI Data Tab loads successfully for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are displayed: ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and correctly labeled in the ADI Data Tab.

test_cases.Preconditions: Daily data acquisition has completed successfully.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with all fields populated in GESTORETE.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab displays all required fields for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify Correct Handling of Allowed Values for Key Ownership Fields

Steps.Step Description: In GESTORETE, set the Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, and Keys AWP Change Coins fields to 'GESTORE' for a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE reflects 'GESTORE' as the value for all key fields.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily data acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT acquires the updated key ownership values.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for the affected ZonaRice.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays 'GESTORE' for all key ownership fields.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 1-3 with the value 'ESERCENTE' for all key fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays 'ESERCENTE' for all key ownership fields.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in GESTORETE and can be edited.
test_cases.Functionality: Allowed values for key ownership fields
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with key fields set to 'GESTORE' and 'ESERCENTE' in GESTORETE.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT correctly displays allowed values ('GESTORE' or 'ESERCENTE') for key ownership fields.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Behavior When GESTORETE is Unavailable During Scheduled Acquisition

Steps.Step Description: Simulate GESTORETE system downtime during the scheduled daily acquisition window.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to connect to GESTORETE and fails.

Steps.Step Description: Check ZENIT logs or monitoring tools for error handling and retry logic.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT logs the failure and, if implemented, retries acquisition as per configuration.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that users are notified of the acquisition failure (if notification is implemented).
Steps.Expected Result: Users receive an appropriate error or warning message regarding the failed acquisition.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and GESTORETE integration is configured; GESTORETE can be made unavailable for testing.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for source system unavailability
test_cases.Dataset: Simulated GESTORETE downtime during acquisition window.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT handles GESTORETE unavailability gracefully and informs users or logs the error appropriately.

test_cases.Title: Daily Import of Cerved Data for Active PoS

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system clock is set to trigger the daily scheduled import job.
Steps.Expected Result: System is ready to execute the daily import job at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the scheduled time or manually trigger the import job (if allowed in test environment).
Steps.Expected Result: Import job starts and attempts to retrieve data from Cerved.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the import process for completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Import process completes without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for each active PoS, the system retrieves the latest CGS and Activity Status from Cerved.
Steps.Expected Result: All active PoS have updated CGS and Activity Status fields in the system.

test_cases.Preconditions: Active PoS exist in the system (issued invoices in last 12 months). Cerved system is available and contains up-to-date data for these PoS.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated daily data acquisition from Cerved for active PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: List of active PoS, Cerved API credentials, test environment with scheduled job capability.
test_cases.Expected Result: System successfully imports and updates CGS and Activity Status for all active PoS from Cerved once per day.

test_cases.Title: Logging and Tracking of Cerved Data Updates

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a Cerved data import (manually or via scheduled job).
Steps.Expected Result: Import process starts.

Steps.Step Description: After import completion, access the system's log or audit trail for Cerved data updates.
Steps.Expected Result: Log entries are present for the import operation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each update to a PoS's CGS or Activity Status is logged with timestamp, PoS identifier, old value, and new value.
Steps.Expected Result: Each change is logged with all required details.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one PoS has a change in CGS or Activity Status in Cerved since the previous import. Logging/audit functionality is enabled.
test_cases.Functionality: Logging and tracking of Cerved data updates.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known data changes in Cerved, access to system logs or audit trail.
test_cases.Expected Result: All updates to PoS Cerved data are logged and tracked with complete details for auditability.

test_cases.Title: Detection of Changes in CGS or Activity Status for Active PoS

Steps.Step Description: Ensure at least one active PoS has a change in CGS or Activity Status in Cerved compared to the previous day.
Steps.Expected Result: Test data is prepared with a known change.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the daily import job.
Steps.Expected Result: Import job runs and completes.

Steps.Step Description: Check the system for records of PoS with detected changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System identifies and records only those PoS with changes in CGS or Activity Status.

test_cases.Preconditions: Active PoS exist with at least one having a change in Cerved data since the last import.
test_cases.Functionality: Detection and processing of changes in Cerved data for active PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: Active PoS with simulated or real changes in Cerved data.
test_cases.Expected Result: System correctly detects and processes only PoS with changes in CGS or Activity Status compared to the previous day.

test_cases.Title: Initiation of Cerved Monitoring for New PoS During Inspection Phase

Steps.Step Description: Create a new PoS and initiate the inspection phase in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: New PoS is in inspection phase.

Steps.Step Description: Request a Cerved report for the new PoS as part of the assessment process.
Steps.Expected Result: System sends a request to Cerved for the new PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the new PoS is now being monitored in Cerved.
Steps.Expected Result: Cerved system reflects the new PoS as monitored.

test_cases.Preconditions: System supports creation of new PoS and integration with Cerved for report requests.
test_cases.Functionality: Monitoring initiation for new PoS in Cerved during inspection phase.
test_cases.Dataset: New PoS details, access to Cerved integration endpoints.
test_cases.Expected Result: New PoS begins to be monitored in Cerved as soon as the first report request is made during inspection.

test_cases.Title: Correct Mapping of CGS to Risk Cluster According to Cerved Clustering Parameter

Steps.Step Description: Obtain or simulate PoS records with CGS values at the boundaries and within each risk cluster range (e.g., 24, 25, 34, 35, 44, etc.).
Steps.Expected Result: Test data covers all risk cluster boundaries.

Steps.Step Description: Import or update these PoS records via the Cerved data acquisition process.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the CGS values for each PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the Dashboard - Single PoS -- Risk Data Tab for each PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Risk cluster is displayed for each PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the displayed risk cluster matches the expected cluster for each CGS value according to the provided matrix.
Steps.Expected Result: Risk cluster mapping is correct for all tested CGS values.

test_cases.Preconditions: System is configured to map CGS to risk clusters as per the provided matrix. Test PoS with required CGS values exist or can be simulated.
test_cases.Functionality: Mapping of CGS to risk cluster for PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each PoS's risk cluster is correctly determined and displayed according to the Cerved Clustering Parameter matrix.

test_cases.Title: Display of Cerved Data in Dashboard - Single PoS and Risk Data Tab

Steps.Step Description: Select a PoS with imported Cerved data (CGS and Activity Status) in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS with Cerved data is available.

Steps.Step Description: Access the Dashboard - Single PoS for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads and displays PoS details.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Risk Data Tab within the Dashboard - Single PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Risk Data Tab is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the CGS, Activity Status, and Risk Cluster are displayed correctly and match the imported data.
Steps.Expected Result: All Cerved data fields are displayed accurately in the UI.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with valid Cerved data exists in the system. User has access to the Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of Cerved data in the Dashboard UI.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known Cerved data (CGS, Activity Status, Risk Cluster).
test_cases.Expected Result: CGS, Activity Status, and Risk Cluster are correctly displayed for each PoS in the Dashboard - Single PoS and Risk Data Tab.

test_cases.Title: Handling of Missing or Invalid CGS Values from Cerved

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a Cerved data import where a PoS has a missing or invalid CGS value (e.g., null, non-numeric, or out-of-range).
Steps.Expected Result: System receives a PoS record with missing/invalid CGS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the import process.
Steps.Expected Result: Import process completes.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the system handles and displays the missing/invalid CGS value in the Dashboard and logs.
Steps.Expected Result: System handles missing/invalid CGS gracefully (e.g., displays 'n.a.' or error message, logs the issue, does not crash).

test_cases.Preconditions: System supports error handling for invalid data. Test PoS with missing/invalid CGS can be created or simulated.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for missing or invalid CGS values from Cerved.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with missing, null, non-numeric, or out-of-range CGS values.
test_cases.Expected Result: System does not fail and provides clear handling and messaging for missing or invalid CGS values.

test_cases.Title: Import Failure and Retry Mechanism for Cerved Data Acquisition

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a failure in the connection to the Cerved system during the scheduled import (e.g., network outage, Cerved API down).
Steps.Expected Result: Import process fails due to external error.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system logs the failure with appropriate error details and timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: Failure is logged with clear error message and timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: Check if the system automatically retries the import according to the defined retry policy (if applicable).
Steps.Expected Result: System retries the import as per configuration or notifies responsible parties if retry fails.

test_cases.Preconditions: System has retry or error notification mechanism for import failures. Ability to simulate Cerved system unavailability.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling and retry for failed Cerved data imports.
test_cases.Dataset: Simulated Cerved system outage or API error.
test_cases.Expected Result: System logs import failures and handles retries or notifications according to requirements, ensuring no data loss or silent failures.

test_cases.Title: Acquisition of Validated Border Data from Valorizzatore at End of Accounting Period

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that the accounting period has ended and Border data has been validated in Valorizzatore.
Steps.Expected Result: Border data is marked as validated and ready for extraction.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the Zenit system's data acquisition process for the relevant accounting period (weekly or bi-weekly as applicable).
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system initiates data acquisition from Valorizzatore.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the data transfer process and verify that the following fields are extracted for each Border: idRice, ZonaRice, Border number, Accounting period (from - to), Total amount of Border.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are extracted and stored in Zenit system for each Border record.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data must be validated and available in Valorizzatore at the end of the accounting period.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample validated Border records in Valorizzatore for a completed accounting period.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system successfully acquires all validated Border data with required fields at the end of the accounting period.

test_cases.Title: Verification of Extracted Border Data Fields in Zenit System

Steps.Step Description: After data acquisition, access the Zenit system's storage or database for the acquired Border records.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to the acquired Border data is granted.

Steps.Step Description: For each Border record, verify the presence and correctness of the following fields: idRice, ZonaRice, Border number, Accounting period (from - to), Total amount of Border.
Steps.Expected Result: Each Border record contains all required fields with correct values as per Valorizzatore source data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data acquisition process has been completed for at least one accounting period.
test_cases.Dataset: Acquired Border records in Zenit system and corresponding source data from Valorizzatore.
test_cases.Expected Result: All acquired Border records in Zenit system contain the required fields with values matching the source data.

test_cases.Title: Calculation of Average Border Over Rolling 12 Months and YTD

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that Border data for at least 12 months is available in the Zenit system.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system contains Border data for the last 12 months.

Steps.Step Description: Access the calculation module or dashboard responsible for computing averages.
Steps.Expected Result: Calculation module/dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or review the calculation of the average Border over the rolling 12-month period and for the current year YTD.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays calculated averages for both rolling 12 months and YTD.

Steps.Step Description: Manually verify the correctness of the calculated averages using the acquired data.
Steps.Expected Result: Calculated averages match manual calculations based on the acquired data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data for at least 12 months must be present in the Zenit system.
test_cases.Dataset: Border data for at least 12 months in Zenit system.
test_cases.Expected Result: System correctly calculates and displays average Border values for rolling 12 months and YTD.

test_cases.Title: Display of Border Data in Dashboard - Single PoS View

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit system with access to the Dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and Dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Dashboard - Single PoS view for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Border data (idRice, ZonaRice, Border number, Accounting period, Total amount) is displayed for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: All required Border data fields are visible and correctly populated for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data for the selected PoS must be present in the Zenit system.
test_cases.Dataset: Zenit system with Border data for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Border data is correctly displayed in the Dashboard - Single PoS view for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Display of Border Data in Dashboard - Single PoS -- "Border" Data Tab

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit system and access the Dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and Dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Dashboard - Single PoS view and select the "Border" Data Tab.
Steps.Expected Result: "Border" Data Tab is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Border data (idRice, ZonaRice, Border number, Accounting period, Total amount) is displayed in the "Border" Data Tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: All required Border data fields are visible and correctly populated in the "Border" Data Tab for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data for the selected PoS must be present in the Zenit system.
test_cases.Dataset: Zenit system with Border data for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Border data is correctly displayed in the Dashboard - Single PoS -- "Border" Data Tab for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Attempt Data Acquisition Before Border Validation

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that the accounting period has not ended or Border data has not been validated in Valorizzatore.
Steps.Expected Result: Border data is not marked as validated.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the Zenit system's data acquisition process for the current accounting period.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system attempts to acquire data.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system does not acquire unvalidated Border data and logs an appropriate error or warning message.
Steps.Expected Result: No unvalidated Border data is acquired; system logs an error or warning.

test_cases.Preconditions: Border data is present in Valorizzatore but not validated.
test_cases.Dataset: Unvalidated Border records in Valorizzatore.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system does not acquire unvalidated Border data and logs an appropriate error or warning.

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Handle Missing or Incomplete Border Data During Acquisition

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that at least one Border record in Valorizzatore is missing one or more required fields (e.g., idRice, ZonaRice, Border number, Accounting period, or Total amount).
Steps.Expected Result: Border record with missing/incomplete data is present in Valorizzatore.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the Zenit system's data acquisition process for the relevant accounting period.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system initiates data acquisition.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system handles the missing/incomplete data according to requirements (e.g., skips the record, logs an error, or flags the record for review).
Steps.Expected Result: System handles missing/incomplete data as per requirements and logs the appropriate message.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one Border record in Valorizzatore is missing required data fields.
test_cases.Dataset: Border records with missing/incomplete fields in Valorizzatore.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system handles missing/incomplete Border data according to requirements and logs the appropriate message.

test_cases.Title: Automatic Acquisition of New Unpaid Data from SAP

Steps.Step Description: Simulate creation of a new unpaid payment for a specific PoS in SAP.
Steps.Expected Result: A new unpaid payment is registered in SAP for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the system to trigger the data acquisition flow.
Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the new unpaid payment event.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system retrieves the following data from SAP: IdRice (PoS Identifier), Unpaid Date, Unpaid Identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: The system obtains all required fields for the new unpaid payment.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the acquired data is sent to the Zenit system for further processing.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit receives the correct unpaid data for the PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one PoS exists in SAP. System integration between SAP and Zenit is configured and operational.
test_cases.Functionality: Automatic data acquisition of new unpaids from SAP
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with no prior unpaid, SAP credentials, test PoS identifier.
test_cases.Expected Result: Whenever a new unpaid is detected in SAP for a PoS, the system automatically acquires and sends the required data (IdRice, Unpaid Date, Unpaid Identifier) to Zenit.

test_cases.Title: Dashboard Display of Aggregated Unpaid Data (Current Year, 6 Months, 12 Months)

Steps.Step Description: Access the Zenit Dashboard and navigate to the Single PoS view.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Unpaids' tab for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the total number of unpaid cases for the current year is correctly displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Current year unpaid count matches the number of unpaids with dates in the current year.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the total number of unpaid cases over the last 6 months is correctly displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: 6-month unpaid count matches the number of unpaids within the last 6 months.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the total number of unpaid cases over the last 12 months is correctly displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: 12-month unpaid count matches the number of unpaids within the last 12 months.

test_cases.Functionality: Display of aggregated unpaid data on Dashboard

test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays correct aggregated unpaid counts for current year, last 6 months, and last 12 months for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: Unpaid Data Visibility in Both 'Unpaids' and 'Risk Data' Tabs

Steps.Step Description: Access the Zenit Dashboard and navigate to the Single PoS view for a PoS with unpaid data.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Unpaids' tab and note the displayed unpaid data and aggregated counts.
Steps.Expected Result: Unpaid data and aggregated counts are visible in the 'Unpaids' tab.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Risk Data' tab for the same PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the same unpaid data and aggregated counts are visible and consistent with the 'Unpaids' tab.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with unpaid data exists. User has access to Zenit Dashboard.
test_cases.Functionality: Visibility and consistency of unpaid data across Dashboard tabs

test_cases.Expected Result: Unpaid data and aggregated counts are consistently displayed in both 'Unpaids' and 'Risk Data' tabs for the same PoS.

test_cases.Title: Error Handling When SAP is Unavailable During Data Acquisition

Steps.Step Description: Simulate SAP system being unavailable (e.g., disconnect SAP or block network access).
Steps.Expected Result: SAP is unreachable from the system.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a new unpaid payment event for a PoS in SAP (or simulate the event).
Steps.Expected Result: System attempts to acquire new unpaid data from SAP.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's behavior and error logging mechanisms.
Steps.Expected Result: System logs an error indicating SAP is unavailable and does not crash.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system retries data acquisition according to the defined retry policy (if applicable).
Steps.Expected Result: System attempts to reacquire data as per retry policy.

test_cases.Preconditions: System is integrated with SAP. Mechanism to simulate SAP unavailability is in place.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling during SAP data acquisition
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with no prior unpaid, SAP credentials, test PoS identifier.
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles SAP unavailability gracefully, logs the error, and retries data acquisition as per policy without data loss or crash.

test_cases.Title: Boundary Test: Unpaid Data at Year, 6-Month, and 12-Month Cutoffs

Steps.Step Description: Create unpaid records for a PoS with dates exactly at the start of the current year, 6 months ago, and 12 months ago.
Steps.Expected Result: Unpaid records with boundary dates are present in the system.

Steps.Step Description: Access the Zenit Dashboard and navigate to the Single PoS view.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Unpaids' tab and review the aggregated counts for current year, last 6 months, and last 12 months.
Steps.Expected Result: Aggregated counts are displayed.

test_cases.Title: Automatic Data Acquisition Triggered by Guarantee Status Change

test_cases.Title: Verify Terminal Data Acquisition and Display for Single PoS

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of available Points of Sale (PoS) is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Go to the 'PoS Master Data' tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'PoS Master Data' tab is opened, showing terminal data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following information is displayed for each Terminal Type: IdRice (PoS identifier), Type ID, Type Name, and Number of Terminals.
Steps.Expected Result: For each Terminal Type at the selected PoS, IdRice, Type ID, Type Name, and Number of Terminals are correctly displayed as per data from ORION.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to ZENIT Dashboard. At least one PoS with terminal data exists in ORION.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with multiple terminal types and data in ORION.
test_cases.Expected Result: Terminal data (IdRice, Type ID, Type Name, Number of Terminals) for each Terminal Type at the selected PoS is accurately displayed in the 'PoS Master Data' tab, matching the data in ORION.

test_cases.Title: Verify Handling of PoS with No Terminal Data

Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of available Points of Sale (PoS) is displayed.

Steps.Expected Result: The 'PoS Master Data' tab is opened.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the display when no terminal data is available for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is shown indicating that no terminal data is available for this PoS, and no terminal data rows are displayed.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Consistency Between ZENIT and ORION for Terminal Data

Steps.Step Description: Obtain terminal data for a specific PoS directly from ORION (IdRice, Type ID, Type Name, Number of Terminals for each Terminal Type).
Steps.Expected Result: Terminal data for the selected PoS is available from ORION.

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' section and select the same PoS as in Step 1.
Steps.Expected Result: The details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Go to the 'PoS Master Data' tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'PoS Master Data' tab is opened, showing terminal data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the terminal data displayed in ZENIT with the data obtained from ORION.
Steps.Expected Result: All terminal data fields (IdRice, Type ID, Type Name, Number of Terminals) in ZENIT exactly match the data from ORION for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to both ZENIT Dashboard and ORION. PoS with terminal data exists in both systems.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with terminal data in both ZENIT and ORION.
test_cases.Expected Result: Terminal data displayed in ZENIT for each PoS and Terminal Type is consistent and matches the data in ORION.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Behavior When ORION is Unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Simulate ORION system unavailability (e.g., disconnect ORION or block network access).
Steps.Expected Result: ORION is not reachable from ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' section and select any PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Go to the 'PoS Master Data' tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'PoS Master Data' tab attempts to load terminal data.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to the unavailability of ORION.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear error message is displayed indicating that terminal data cannot be retrieved due to ORION unavailability. No outdated or partial data is shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to ZENIT Dashboard. ORION is temporarily unavailable.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; ORION system offline or unreachable.
test_cases.Expected Result: When ORION is unavailable, ZENIT displays a clear error message and does not show outdated or partial terminal data.

test_cases.Title: Successful Login with Valid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application's login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username and password into the respective fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Username and password are accepted as input.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application's home/dashboard page.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists and is active. User is logged out.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password (e.g., user@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the home/dashboard page.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Invalid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application's login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid username and/or password into the respective fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Username and password are accepted as input.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication fails and an error message is displayed (e.g., 'Invalid username or password').

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged out.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid username and/or password (e.g., user@example.com / WrongPass)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not logged in and receives an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Empty Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application's login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the username and password fields empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields remain empty.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication is not attempted and an error message is displayed (e.g., 'Username and password are required').

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged out.
test_cases.Dataset: No input (empty fields)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not logged in and receives an error message indicating required fields.

test_cases.Title: Successful Logout from Application

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and on the home/dashboard page.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Logout' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user session
test_cases.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page. Session is terminated.

test_cases.Title: Session Expiry and Automatic Logout

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and on the home/dashboard page.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive for the session timeout period (e.g., 15 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Session remains active until timeout.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform any action after the session timeout period.
Steps.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out and redirected to the login page. A session expiry message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in. Session timeout is configured (e.g., 15 minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user session
test_cases.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out after session expiry and redirected to the login page.

test_cases.Title: Login with Case Sensitivity Check

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application's login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username with incorrect case (e.g., USER@EXAMPLE.COM) and the correct password.
Steps.Expected Result: Username is accepted as input.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication fails and an error message is displayed if the system is case-sensitive.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged out. System is configured to treat usernames as case-sensitive.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username with incorrect case and correct password
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not logged in if the username is case-sensitive. Appropriate error message is displayed.

test_cases.Title: Full Access User - Access to All ZENIT Features

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with the 'Full Access User' role.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the data consultation section.
Steps.Expected Result: User can view and consult all available data.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the data extraction section and attempt to extract data.
Steps.Expected Result: User can extract data without restrictions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the massive import section and attempt to perform a massive import operation.
Steps.Expected Result: User can access and execute massive import functionality.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the threshold management section and attempt to manage thresholds.
Steps.Expected Result: User can fully manage all thresholds (add, edit, delete).

test_cases.Preconditions: A user account with 'Full Access User' role exists and is assigned to at least one country.
test_cases.Functionality: Role-based access control for Full Access User
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with 'Full Access User' role; test data for import and threshold management.
test_cases.Expected Result: Full Access User can access and perform all ZENIT features as per their role, with no access restrictions.
