test_cases.Expected Result: IT Support user cannot modify or delete logs; only read access is permitted.

test_cases.Title: Successful Login with MFA (Push Notification)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page and click the 'Access' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid company username and password, then submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts credentials and prompts for second factor authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Approve the login request via push notification on the Authenticator App.
Steps.Expected Result: System verifies the second factor and grants access to the ZENIT back-office, displaying the correct environment (e.g., TEST, PROD).

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT, has MFA and Authenticator App configured, and is enabled for login.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password for a login-enabled user; Authenticator App installed and configured.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the ZENIT home page with environment clearly displayed.

test_cases.Title: Successful Login with MFA (OTP Code)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page and click the 'Access' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid company username and password, then submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts credentials and prompts for second factor authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Authenticator App on the mobile device and retrieve the current OTP code.
Steps.Expected Result: OTP code is visible in the Authenticator App.

Steps.Step Description: Enter the OTP code into the system interface and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System verifies the OTP and grants access to the ZENIT back-office, displaying the correct environment.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT, has MFA and Authenticator App configured, and is enabled for login.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password for a login-enabled user; Authenticator App installed and configured; valid OTP code.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the ZENIT home page with environment clearly displayed.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Invalid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page and click the 'Access' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid username or password and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message: 'Invalid credentials' and allows another attempt.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT and has MFA configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid username or password.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not authenticated and receives an 'Invalid credentials' error message.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Invalid Second Factor (OTP/Push)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page and click the 'Access' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid company username and password, then submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts credentials and prompts for second factor authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid OTP code or reject the push notification in the Authenticator App.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message indicating the second factor is invalid and denies access.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT, has MFA and Authenticator App configured, and is enabled for login.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password; invalid OTP code or rejected push notification.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not authenticated and receives an error message for invalid second factor.

test_cases.Title: Logout Functionality

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back-office successfully (as per TC-001 or TC-002).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and on the ZENIT home page.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Logout' or 'Exit' button in the application.
Steps.Expected Result: System closes the user session and redirects to the login page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a protected resource or page via browser back or direct URL.
Steps.Expected Result: System denies access and redirects to the login page.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in to ZENIT back-office.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid login session.
test_cases.Expected Result: User session is terminated and access to protected resources is blocked until next login.

test_cases.Title: Environment Display on Login

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page in a specific environment (e.g., TEST, PROD, DEV, PREPROD).
Steps.Expected Result: Login page loads for the selected environment.

Steps.Step Description: Log in successfully using valid credentials and MFA.
Steps.Expected Result: After login, the system clearly displays the current environment (e.g., banner, label, or header).

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT, has MFA configured, and accesses a specific environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid credentials; access to multiple environments.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can unambiguously identify the current environment after login.

test_cases.Title: Audit Log for Login and Logout Events

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back-office successfully (as per TC-001 or TC-002).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and on the ZENIT home page.

Steps.Step Description: Log out of the application using the 'Logout' or 'Exit' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User session is terminated.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log (requires appropriate permissions or admin access).
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains entries for both login and logout events with correct timestamps and user identification.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is registered in ZENIT, has MFA configured, and has access to audit logs (admin or auditor profile).
test_cases.Dataset: Valid credentials; access to audit logs.
test_cases.Expected Result: Login and logout events are recorded in the audit log for traceability.

test_cases.Title: Automatic Logout After 5 Minutes of Inactivity

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction (mouse, keyboard, touch, etc.) for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No activity is detected by the system during this period.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system after 5 minutes of inactivity.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a notification (e.g., pop-up) warning that the session is about to expire due to inactivity, possibly with a countdown timer.

Steps.Step Description: Do not interact with the system after the notification appears. Wait until the countdown timer expires.
Steps.Expected Result: System automatically logs out the user, logs the disconnect event, and redirects to the login screen.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the ZENIT system. No other active sessions for the same user.
test_cases.Functionality: Session Management - Automatic Logout for Inactivity
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user: testuser, password: Test@123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out after 5 minutes of inactivity, a disconnect event is logged, and the user is redirected to the login screen.

test_cases.Title: Session Remains Active with Continuous User Activity

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform any user interaction (e.g., click, type, or move mouse) at least once every 4 minutes for a total duration of 10 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: Each interaction is registered by the system as activity.

Steps.Step Description: Observe whether the system displays any inactivity notification or logs out the user during this period.
Steps.Expected Result: No inactivity notification is displayed and the user remains logged in throughout the 10-minute period.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the ZENIT system. No other active sessions for the same user.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user: testuser, password: Test@123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User session remains active and uninterrupted as long as user activity is detected within the inactivity threshold.

test_cases.Title: Session Continuation Upon User Response to Inactivity Notification

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No activity is detected by the system during this period.

Steps.Step Description: When the inactivity notification with countdown appears, click the 'Continue' button before the countdown expires.
Steps.Expected Result: System registers the interaction and cancels the pending automatic logout.

Steps.Step Description: Continue using the system normally for at least 2 more minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User remains logged in and no further inactivity notification appears during this period.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the ZENIT system. No other active sessions for the same user.
test_cases.Functionality: Session Management - Inactivity Notification and Session Extension
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user: testuser, password: Test@123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User session continues without logout if the user responds to the inactivity notification before the countdown expires.

test_cases.Title: System Logs Disconnect Event Upon Automatic Logout

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction for 5 minutes and allow the system to automatically log out the user after inactivity notification and countdown.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login screen.

Steps.Step Description: Access the system logs as an administrator or via backend tools.
Steps.Expected Result: A disconnect event corresponding to the user's session logout due to inactivity is present in the system logs, including timestamp and user identifier.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the ZENIT system. Access to system logs is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Session Management - Logging of Automatic Logout Events
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user: testuser, password: Test@123); access to system logs.
test_cases.Expected Result: A disconnect event is logged in the system logs when a user is automatically logged out due to inactivity.

test_cases.Title: Session Timeout Notification Includes Countdown Timer and Action Option

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No activity is detected by the system during this period.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the inactivity notification when it appears.
Steps.Expected Result: Notification includes a visible countdown timer and a 'Continue' button or similar action to keep the session active.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the ZENIT system. No other active sessions for the same user.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user: testuser, password: Test@123)
test_cases.Expected Result: Inactivity notification displays a countdown timer and an action option to continue the session.

test_cases.Title: Verify login tracking records all required user information upon successful authentication

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the application dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Access the secure database or audit log as an authorized personnel.
Steps.Expected Result: A new login record is present for the authenticated user.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the login record contains the following fields: Username, Surname and First Name, Email address, Title, Department, Date of Last Login, Status of the Username, and Role.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and correctly populated in the login record.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists with all profile fields populated. Tester has access to the secure audit log database as authorized personnel.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; access to audit log database.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon successful login, all required user information is recorded in the secure database as per SOX compliance.

test_cases.Title: Verify login tracking does not record information for failed authentication attempts

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to login to the application with invalid credentials (e.g., incorrect password).
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication fails and user is not granted access.

Steps.Step Description: Access the secure database or audit log as an authorized personnel.
Steps.Expected Result: No new login record is created for the failed authentication attempt.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists. Tester has access to the secure audit log database as authorized personnel.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid user credentials; access to audit log database.
test_cases.Expected Result: No login record is created in the database for failed authentication attempts.

test_cases.Title: Verify only authorized personnel can access login tracking records

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application as a user without audit log access privileges.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the secure database or audit log containing login tracking records.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists without audit log access privileges. Audit log database is present.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials without audit log access; audit log database.
test_cases.Expected Result: Only authorized personnel can access login tracking records; unauthorized users are denied access.

test_cases.Title: Verify login tracking records are stored securely in the database

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Access the database storage configuration as an authorized administrator.
Steps.Expected Result: Database is configured with encryption and access controls as per security policy.

Steps.Step Description: Review the storage of login tracking records for evidence of encryption or secure storage mechanisms.
Steps.Expected Result: Login tracking records are stored securely and are not accessible in plain text to unauthorized users.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists. Tester has administrator access to database configuration.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; access to database configuration.
test_cases.Expected Result: Login tracking records are securely stored in the database with appropriate encryption and access controls.

test_cases.Title: Verify login tracking records update 'Date of Last Login' field correctly on subsequent logins

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log and note the 'Date of Last Login' for the user.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Date of Last Login' matches the current login timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: Logout and wait for a measurable time interval (e.g., 5 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out.

Steps.Step Description: Login again with the same user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log and verify the 'Date of Last Login' field is updated to the new login timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Date of Last Login' reflects the most recent login time.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists. Tester has access to audit log database.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; access to audit log database.
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Date of Last Login' field is updated correctly on each successful login.

test_cases.Title: Verify login tracking records correct 'Status of the Username' for active and inactive users

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user account that is active.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log and verify the 'Status of the Username' field for the login record.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Status of the Username' is recorded as 'Active'.

Steps.Step Description: Deactivate the user account in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: User account status is set to 'Inactive'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to login with the deactivated user account.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication fails.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log and verify that no new login record is created for the deactivated account.
Steps.Expected Result: No login record is created for the failed login attempt with an inactive account.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists and can be deactivated. Tester has access to audit log database.
test_cases.Dataset: Active and inactive user credentials; access to audit log database.
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Status of the Username' is correctly recorded for active users and no login record is created for inactive users.

test_cases.Title: Verify Control Room Team Can Access Login Tracking Data in Splunk

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application using valid Control Room team credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and gains access to the Splunk dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard or section dedicated to ZENIT login tracking information.
Steps.Expected Result: The dashboard or section for ZENIT login tracking is visible and accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for recent login events recorded in the ZENIT system.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of recent login events from the ZENIT system is displayed, including relevant details (e.g., username, timestamp, IP address).

test_cases.Preconditions: User must be a member of the Control Room team with valid Splunk access. ZENIT system must be configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
test_cases.Functionality: Visualization of login tracking data by authorized team
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room team credentials; ZENIT login events present in Splunk.
test_cases.Expected Result: Control Room team member can view ZENIT login tracking information in Splunk without errors or access issues.

test_cases.Title: Verify Unauthorized User Cannot Access ZENIT Login Tracking Data in Splunk

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application using credentials of a user not belonging to the Control Room team.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and gains access to Splunk with limited permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard or section.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard or section is denied or not visible.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must not be a member of the Control Room team. ZENIT system must be configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
test_cases.Functionality: Access control for login tracking data
test_cases.Dataset: Non-Control Room user credentials; ZENIT login events present in Splunk.
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthorized users cannot access or view ZENIT login tracking information in Splunk.

test_cases.Title: Verify ZENIT Login Tracking Data is Up-to-Date in Splunk

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with a test user account to generate a new login event.
Steps.Expected Result: Login event is successfully generated in the ZENIT system.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Splunk as a Control Room team member.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access the Splunk dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard and search for the test user's recent login event.
Steps.Expected Result: The new login event appears in the Splunk dashboard within an acceptable time frame (e.g., less than 5 minutes after the event).

test_cases.Preconditions: Test user account available in ZENIT. Control Room team member has Splunk access. ZENIT system is configured to send login events to Splunk.
test_cases.Functionality: Timeliness of login tracking data visualization
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials for ZENIT; Control Room team credentials for Splunk.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT login tracking data is updated in Splunk in near real-time after login events occur.

test_cases.Title: Verify Login Tracking Data Includes Required Fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Splunk as a Control Room team member.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access the Splunk dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard and select a recent login event.
Steps.Expected Result: Details of the selected login event are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the login event includes all required fields (e.g., username, timestamp, IP address, login status).
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and populated with correct values.

test_cases.Preconditions: Control Room team member has Splunk access. ZENIT system is configured to send login events with all required fields.
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room team credentials; ZENIT login events with all required fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each login event in Splunk contains all required fields as per specification.

test_cases.Title: Verify Error Handling When ZENIT Login Tracking Data is Unavailable in Splunk

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a scenario where ZENIT login tracking data is not sent to Splunk (e.g., disconnect data source or stop data feed).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT login tracking data is not available in Splunk.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Splunk as a Control Room team member and navigate to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear error message or notification is displayed indicating that login tracking data is currently unavailable.

test_cases.Preconditions: Control Room team member has Splunk access. Ability to simulate data unavailability in test environment.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for missing login tracking data
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room team credentials; test environment where ZENIT data feed can be interrupted.
test_cases.Expected Result: System displays a clear error or notification when ZENIT login tracking data is unavailable in Splunk.

test_cases.Title: Simultaneous Data Update by Multiple Users

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the shared data record (e.g., customer profile).
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same data record as User A.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A edits a field (e.g., phone number) and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts and saves User A's changes.

Steps.Step Description: User B, without refreshing, edits a different field (e.g., email address) and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts User B's changes without overwriting User A's update. Both changes are reflected in the record.

test_cases.Preconditions: Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights. The shared data record exists.
test_cases.Functionality: Concurrency management for simultaneous data updates
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; existing data record with editable fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: System maintains data consistency and integrity, reflecting both users' changes without data loss or conflict.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent updates to different fields of the same record.

test_cases.Title: Conflict Detection on Simultaneous Edit of Same Field

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and opens a shared data record for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User A accesses the data record in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and opens the same data record for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User B accesses the data record in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User A changes the value of a specific field (e.g., address) and saves the record.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves User A's changes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User B, without refreshing, changes the same field to a different value and attempts to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the conflict and prompts User B with a conflict resolution message (e.g., 'This record has been modified by another user. Please review the latest changes.').

test_cases.Preconditions: Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights. The shared data record exists.
test_cases.Functionality: Conflict detection and resolution for concurrent edits
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; existing data record with editable fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: System detects concurrent modification and prevents silent overwrites, prompting the user to resolve the conflict.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers conflict detection for simultaneous edits to the same field.

test_cases.Title: Simultaneous Record Creation by Multiple Users

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and initiates the creation of a new record with unique identifier 'X'.
Steps.Expected Result: User A is able to fill in the new record form.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and simultaneously initiates the creation of a new record with the same unique identifier 'X'.
Steps.Expected Result: User B is able to fill in the new record form.

Steps.Step Description: User A submits the new record creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: System creates the new record with identifier 'X' for User A.

Steps.Step Description: User B submits the new record creation form with the same identifier 'X'.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects User B's submission and displays an error message indicating that the identifier 'X' already exists.

test_cases.Preconditions: Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; unique identifier 'X'.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents duplicate record creation and maintains data integrity.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent creation of records with unique constraints.

test_cases.Title: Simultaneous Deletion and Update of the Same Record

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and opens a shared data record for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User A accesses the data record in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and opens the same data record for deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: User B accesses the data record and selects the delete option.

Steps.Step Description: User B deletes the record and confirms the deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: System deletes the record and removes it from the database.

Steps.Step Description: User A, without refreshing, attempts to save changes to the now-deleted record.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message to User A indicating that the record no longer exists and cannot be updated.

test_cases.Preconditions: Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights. The shared data record exists.
test_cases.Functionality: Concurrency management for simultaneous update and deletion
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; existing data record.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents updates to deleted records and maintains data consistency.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent update and deletion scenarios.

test_cases.Title: Concurrent Read Operations by Multiple Users

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to a shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses and views the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same data record at the same time.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses and views the same data record.

test_cases.Preconditions: Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights. The shared data record exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; existing data record.
test_cases.Expected Result: System allows multiple users to read the same data simultaneously without errors or data inconsistency.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent read-only access.

test_cases.Title: Verify Settings Persist After Logout and Login

test_cases.Title: Verify Log Entry Integrity and Tamper Resistance

test_cases.Title: Verify Log Retention and Purge Policy Enforcement

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the application is running and logging/auditing is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Generate log entries by performing various actions (e.g., login, data modification).

Steps.Expected Result: System time reflects the end of the retention period.

Steps.Step Description: Access the log/audit records as an administrator or authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: Log/audit records are accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that log entries older than the retention period are purged according to policy.
Steps.Expected Result: Log entries older than the retention period are no longer present; recent entries remain.

test_cases.Preconditions: Logging/auditing feature is enabled. Log retention policy is configured. Tester has access to log/audit records.
test_cases.Dataset: Actions to generate logs; admin access to logs; ability to simulate time passage.
test_cases.Expected Result: Log entries are retained and purged according to the configured retention policy.

test_cases.Title: Verify Log Entry Format for Modification Operations

Steps.Step Description: Perform a modification operation on the database (e.g., update a user record) as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: A log entry is generated for the modification operation.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve the generated log entry from the log storage system.
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry is accessible for review by authorized personnel.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the log entry description matches the required template: #*<applicationName>*# #AUDIT# #*<actionCategory>*# User '<username>' having role '<userRole>' has performed the following action: <actionDescription>
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry description strictly follows the specified template with correct values for applicationName, actionCategory, username, userRole, and actionDescription.

test_cases.Preconditions: User with modification privileges exists. Logging system is enabled and configured as per company standards.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials, sample modification operation data
test_cases.Expected Result: All modification operations generate log entries with descriptions that strictly adhere to the required template.

test_cases.Title: Verify Log Entry Format for Validation Actions

Steps.Step Description: Perform a validation action in the application as an authorized user (e.g., validate a transaction).
Steps.Expected Result: A log entry is generated for the validation action.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve the generated log entry from the log storage system.
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry is accessible for review by authorized personnel.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the log entry description matches the required template: #*<applicationName>*# #AUDIT# #*<actionCategory>*# User '<username>' having role '<userRole>' has performed the following action: <actionDescription>
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry description strictly follows the specified template with correct values for applicationName, actionCategory, username, userRole, and actionDescription.

test_cases.Preconditions: User with validation privileges exists. Logging system is enabled and configured as per company standards.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials, sample validation action data
test_cases.Expected Result: All validation actions generate log entries with descriptions that strictly adhere to the required template.

test_cases.Title: Verify Extended Retention Policy for Audit Logs

Steps.Step Description: Perform a modification or validation operation that triggers an audit log entry.
Steps.Expected Result: An audit log entry is generated and stored.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the standard log retention period to elapse (simulate or check system configuration).
Steps.Expected Result: Standard logs are purged according to the retention policy.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the audit log entry generated in Step 1 is still retained beyond the standard log retention period.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log entry is retained as per the extended retention policy.

test_cases.Preconditions: Log retention policies are configured. Audit log retention is set longer than standard logs.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample operation data, retention policy configuration
test_cases.Expected Result: Audit logs are retained for a longer period than standard logs, as per configuration.

test_cases.Title: Verify Immutability of Audit Logs

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify the generated audit log entry using administrative or direct database access.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete the generated audit log entry using administrative or direct database access.

test_cases.Dataset: Sample operation data, admin credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: Audit logs are immutable and cannot be modified or deleted once registered.

test_cases.Title: Verify Access Control for Audit Logs (Safety)

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access audit logs as an authorized user (if applicable at this phase).

test_cases.Title: Verify No Visibility of Audit Logs to Authorized Users (Accessibility)

test_cases.Title: Export Related PoS to Excel - Filename and Content Verification

Steps.Step Description: Search for a Single PoS and navigate to its Related PoS section in the Zenit application.
Steps.Expected Result: A table displaying Related PoS is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Export to Excel' button in the Related PoS section.
Steps.Expected Result: An Excel file download is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Save the downloaded file locally.
Steps.Expected Result: File is saved on the local machine.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the filename format is 'RelatedPoS_<idrice>_<zonarice>_<yyyymmddhhmm>.xlsx', where <idrice> and <zonarice> match the reference PoS and <yyyymmddhhmm> matches the extraction timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: Filename matches the required pattern and values.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Excel file and verify it contains all Related PoS data presented in the table.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file contains all data for the Related PoS as shown in the table.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into Zenit and has access to the search and export functionality. The Single PoS has at least one Related PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Single PoS with known idrice and zonarice and at least one Related PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Excel file is generated with correct filename and contains all data for the Related PoS as displayed in the table.

test_cases.Title: Export to Excel - Filename Format Negative Test (Invalid Timestamp)

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search and export any PoS data to Excel.
Steps.Expected Result: An Excel file download is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Check the filename of the downloaded file for correct timestamp format (<yyyymmddhhmm>).
Steps.Expected Result: Filename contains a valid timestamp in the required format.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to export at a known time and verify that the timestamp in the filename matches the system time (to the minute).
Steps.Expected Result: Timestamp in filename matches the system time at export.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into Zenit and has access to the export functionality. System time is known and synchronized.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; known system time.
test_cases.Expected Result: Filename always contains a valid timestamp matching the export time; any deviation is a defect.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only timestamp validation in filename.

test_cases.Title: Export to Excel - Data Consistency After Search Update

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search for PoS and note the results displayed in the table.
Steps.Expected Result: A table with PoS results is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Export to Excel' and download the file.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is downloaded.

Steps.Step Description: Change the search criteria and perform a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: Table updates to reflect new search results.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Export to Excel' again and download the new file.
Steps.Expected Result: A new Excel file is downloaded.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the contents of both Excel files with their respective table data at the time of export.
Steps.Expected Result: Each Excel file matches the table data at the time of its respective export.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into Zenit and has access to the search and export functionality. Multiple search criteria are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; multiple search criteria.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each exported Excel file reflects the data present in the table at the time of export, ensuring no stale or incorrect data is exported.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers data consistency after search update.

test_cases.Title: Export to Excel - Error Handling When No Data is Present

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search that returns no PoS results in the Zenit application.
Steps.Expected Result: A message indicating no results found is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click the 'Export to Excel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: System either disables the export button or displays an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into Zenit and has access to the search and export functionality. System contains no PoS matching the search criteria.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; search criteria returning zero results.
test_cases.Expected Result: Export to Excel is not allowed when no data is present, and user is informed appropriately.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for empty search results.

test_cases.Title: Default Activation of Credit Management Section for Single PoS

Steps.Step Description: Login to the dashboard as a user with access to a single PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Expected Result: The PoS details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the sections displayed on the PoS details page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Credit Management' section is active and visible by default, providing an overview of credit lines/products.

test_cases.Functionality: Default activation and visibility of Credit Management section

test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Credit Management' section is active and visible by default when viewing an individual PoS.

test_cases.Title: Display of Credit Lines and Products in Credit Management Section

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with all credit lines assigned.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the presence of the following sections: 'FIDO SIMP GG' (Daily), 'FIDO SIMP WK' (Weekly), and 'FIDO GEO' (Weekly).
Steps.Expected Result: All three sections are present and clearly labeled.

Steps.Step Description: Within 'FIDO SIMP GG', verify the presence of product lines: TOTOCALCIO, IPPICA, SPORT QF, VIRTUAL, and GLOBALE.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified product lines are present as rows in the table.

Steps.Step Description: Within 'FIDO SIMP WK', verify the presence of product lines: TOTOCALCIO, IPPICA, SPORT QF, VIRTUAL, and GLOBALE.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified product lines are present as rows in the table.

Steps.Step Description: Within 'FIDO GEO', verify the presence of product lines: GNTN, CORNER, ONLINE, and TOTALE.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified product lines are present as rows in the table.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS has all types of credit lines/products assigned.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of credit lines/products per section
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with all credit lines/products assigned
test_cases.Expected Result: All required credit lines/products are displayed in their respective sections as specified.

test_cases.Title: Display of Credit Line Information Fields for Each Product Line

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with at least one credit line assigned.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: For each product line in all sections, verify the presence of the following columns: Base Amount (BASE), Extension Amount (ESTENSIONE), Total (TOTALE), Consumed (CONSUMATO), % Consumed (%CONSUMO), Residue (RESIDUO).
Steps.Expected Result: All specified columns are present for each product line.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with at least one credit line assigned.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of required information fields for each credit line/product
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with at least one credit line assigned
test_cases.Expected Result: Each product line displays all required information fields as columns.

test_cases.Title: Correct Calculation and Display of Credit Line Values

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with known credit line values.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: For a selected product line, verify that Total (TOTALE) equals Base Amount (BASE) plus Extension Amount (ESTENSIONE).
Steps.Expected Result: TOTALE = BASE + ESTENSIONE for the product line.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that % Consumed (%CONSUMO) equals (CONSUMATO / TOTALE) * 100%.
Steps.Expected Result: %CONSUMO is correctly calculated and displayed as a percentage.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Residue (RESIDUO) equals TOTALE minus CONSUMATO.
Steps.Expected Result: RESIDUO = TOTALE - CONSUMATO for the product line.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with known, non-zero credit line values for at least one product line.
test_cases.Functionality: Calculation and display of credit line values
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known credit line values (e.g., BASE=1000, ESTENSIONE=200, CONSUMATO=500)
test_cases.Expected Result: All calculated fields (TOTALE, %CONSUMO, RESIDUO) are correct for each product line.

test_cases.Title: Display of Zero Values When No Credit Line Exists

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with no credit lines assigned.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all data fields (BASE, ESTENSIONE, TOTALE, CONSUMATO, %CONSUMO, RESIDUO) display zero values for all product lines.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields display zero values for all product lines.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with no credit lines assigned.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of zero values in absence of credit lines
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with no credit lines assigned
test_cases.Expected Result: All fields display zero values when no credit line exists for the PoS.

test_cases.Title: Display and Calculation of Summary Totals at Bottom of Credit Management Section

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with multiple credit lines assigned.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll to the bottom of the Credit Management section and locate the Totals Section.
Steps.Expected Result: Totals Section is visible at the bottom of the page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Total Daily Credits' is displayed and equals the sum of all metrics related to daily credits (FIDO SIMP GG).
Steps.Expected Result: Total Daily Credits is correctly calculated and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that 'Total Weekly Credits (Rolling + Static)' is displayed and equals the sum of all weekly credits (FIDO SIMP WK + FIDO GEO).
Steps.Expected Result: Total Weekly Credits (Rolling + Static) is correctly calculated and displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with multiple credit lines assigned (daily and weekly).
test_cases.Functionality: Display and calculation of summary totals
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with multiple credit lines assigned (known values for daily and weekly credits)
test_cases.Expected Result: Summary totals for daily and weekly credits are displayed and correctly calculated at the bottom of the section.

test_cases.Title: UI Structure: Table Layout and Section Organization in Credit Management

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for any PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each credit type section (FIDO SIMP GG, FIDO SIMP WK, FIDO GEO) contains a table.
Steps.Expected Result: Each section contains a table.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each table has rows for product lines and columns for the required fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Each table is organized with product lines as rows and required fields as columns.

test_cases.Functionality: UI structure and organization of Credit Management section
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with at least one credit line assigned
test_cases.Expected Result: Each section is organized as a table with correct rows and columns.

test_cases.Title: Boundary Value: Maximum and Minimum Credit Line Values Display and Calculation

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section for a PoS with credit lines set to maximum allowed values.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all fields (BASE, ESTENSIONE, TOTALE, CONSUMATO, %CONSUMO, RESIDUO) display and calculate correctly for maximum values.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields display and calculate correctly for maximum values.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 1-2 for a PoS with credit lines set to minimum (zero) values.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields display and calculate correctly for minimum values (zero).

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with credit lines set to maximum and minimum allowed values.
test_cases.Functionality: Boundary value handling for credit line fields
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with credit lines at maximum and minimum values
test_cases.Expected Result: Fields display and calculate correctly for both maximum and minimum (zero) values.

test_cases.Title: Error Handling: Display When Credit Line Data is Missing or Corrupted

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a scenario where the credit line data for a PoS is missing or corrupted (e.g., via test data injection or backend manipulation).
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system displays an appropriate error message or fallback (e.g., zero values or 'Data not available') for affected fields.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a clear error message or fallback for missing/corrupted data without crashing.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with missing or corrupted credit line data (test environment setup required).
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for missing/corrupted credit line data
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with missing/corrupted credit line data
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles missing/corrupted data gracefully, displaying appropriate messages or fallbacks.

test_cases.Title: Verify PoS Master Data Visualization for All Fields

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Dashboard with a user profile that has full access to PoS Master Data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' section and select a specific PoS entry.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS Master Data section is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following PoS data fields are visible and populated: PV Type, Business Type, Network Cluster, Tax Code PoS, Address, Fraction, Province Code, Postal Code, Region, Country, Phone, Phone 2, email.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed PoS data fields are visible and display correct values.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following Holder data fields are visible and populated: Last Name of Holder, First Name of Holder, Tax Code of Holder, Mobile of Holder, Mobile of Holder 2.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed Holder data fields are visible and display correct values.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for each Line of Business (LdB), the following fields are visible: LdB Name, LdB Status, Date of the last transfer.
Steps.Expected Result: All LdB data fields are visible for each LdB and display correct values.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following Betting data fields are visible and populated: SIMP Code, SIMP Alias, Sports Concession Code, Horse-Racing Concession Code, Sports Grant Code, Horse-Racing Grant Code.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed Betting data fields are visible and display correct values.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for each terminal type, the following fields are visible: Terminal Type, Number of Terminals by Type.
Steps.Expected Result: All Terminal data fields are visible and display correct values.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following Other data fields are visible and populated: Prepaid flag, Mysisal flag, Activation date of the channel 1, Date of the last transfer (Voltura), AM (last name and first name).
Steps.Expected Result: All Other data fields are visible and display correct values.

test_cases.Title: AWP Data Visualization - Structured Aggregation by Management Type and Collection Method

Steps.Step Description: Login to the XPS-ZENIT-360 Dashboard as a user with access to Single PoS ADI Data.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads successfully and the ADI Data section is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'ADI Data' section for a selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ADI Data section is displayed with AWP and VLT data blocks.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that AWP data is displayed in three separate blocks: AWP Management, AWP AC Management, and AWP Third Parties.
Steps.Expected Result: Three distinct blocks for AWP data are visible, each labeled appropriately.

Steps.Step Description: Within each block, check that AWP numbers are divided by collection method: IAG and NOIAG.
Steps.Expected Result: Each block displays AWP numbers for both IAG and NOIAG collection methods.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each block also displays the total AWP for that block.
Steps.Expected Result: A total AWP value is shown for each block, summing IAG and NOIAG values.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to a PoS with AWP and VLT data configured.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with AWP data for all management types and collection methods (IAG, NOIAG).
test_cases.Expected Result: AWP data is correctly structured and aggregated by management type and collection method, with accurate totals per block.

test_cases.Title: Verify Display of Risk Data Table with All Columns for Single PoS

test_cases.Title: Verify Correct Values and Formats in Risk Data Table Columns

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to the Single PoS 'Risk Data' section as described in TC-XPS-ZENIT-365-001.
Steps.Expected Result: Risk Data table is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'RedList' column for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is either 'Yes' or 'No'.

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'Insolvent Rolling 6 months' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a non-negative integer (e.g., 0, 1, 2, ...).

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'General Reason' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a brief text description (e.g., 'Customer at risk').

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'SIMP Management' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a valid status or outcome (e.g., 'Checked', 'Not Checked').

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'SIMP Reason' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a detailed text description related to SIMP checks.

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'Scoring' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a numerical score (e.g., 0-1000) assigned by Cerved.

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'Risk Cluster' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a risk category (e.g., 'Low', 'Medium', 'High').

Steps.Step Description: Check the value in the 'Activity Status' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Value is a valid status (e.g., 'ACTIVE', 'SUSPENDED', 'CLOSED').

test_cases.Preconditions: Risk Data table is visible for a PoS with populated data.
test_cases.Functionality: Validation of Risk Data Table Values and Formats
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known risk data values for each column
test_cases.Expected Result: All columns display values in the correct format and within valid ranges for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Expected Result: All three monitoring categories are displayed with correct table structure, headers, aggregated rows, and subtotals.

test_cases.Title: Detailed Visualization of Winning Data Fields

Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Winning Data dashboard.

Steps.Expected Result: Detailed data for the selected win is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the presence and format of the following fields: Seller Agency Code, Competence Day, Cash Day, Winning Payment Day, Agency Code Payment, PoS Identifier of the payment, Amount Bet, Amount Won.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields are present. Seller Agency Code and Agency Code Payment are 6-character strings left-padded with zeros. PoS Identifier is a 4-character string left-padded with zeros. Dates are in correct format. Amounts are numeric.

test_cases.Expected Result: All required fields are displayed with correct format and values in the detailed view.

test_cases.Title: Seller Agency Code Format for Standard and Corner PoS

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Winning Data dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Winning Data dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Expand a row in any section to view the Seller Agency Code for a standard PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Seller Agency Code is a 6-character string left-padded with zeros (e.g., 000045).

Steps.Step Description: Expand a row for a 'Corner' type PoS and observe the Seller Agency Code.
Steps.Expected Result: Seller Agency Code is in the format 'ZZZZ-XXXXXX', where ZZZZ is the 4-digit zone number left-padded with zeros, and XXXXXX is the 6-digit SIMP code left-padded with zeros (e.g., 0001-000045).

test_cases.Preconditions: Test data includes both standard and 'Corner' type PoS records.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials, sample data for standard and 'Corner' PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Seller Agency Code is correctly formatted for both standard and 'Corner' PoS types.

test_cases.Title: Reference Day Management - Automatic and Manual Selection

test_cases.Title: Verify Calculated Fields in 'Corner' Data Visualization

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Zenit dashboard as a user with access to a PoS of type 'Corner'.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Business Data' section for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the values for BC Year Projection, Decile, and Exposure Risk are correctly calculated based on the provided formulas and displayed data.
Steps.Expected Result: Calculated fields display correct values as per the formulas: BC Year Projection = (Business Contribution (YTD) / <Previous Months>) * 12; Decile = BC Year Projection / 10; Exposure Risk = Current year medium border * 1.8.

test_cases.Dataset: PoS ID of type 'Corner', valid user credentials, imported business data with known values for calculation
test_cases.Expected Result: Calculated fields in the 'Corner' block are accurate and match the expected results based on the input data and formulas.

Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Massive Importer'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Import Profit and Loss - Gaming Hall'.
Steps.Expected Result: Import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the original CdG file (e.g., 'P&L GAMING HALL YTD M05 2024 sent.xlsx') instead of the required template.
Steps.Expected Result: File is selected for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Submit the file for import.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a validation error indicating that the file does not match the required template and the import is not performed.

test_cases.Reference System: Import Profit and Loss - Gaming Hall
test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the ZENIT system. Original CdG file is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Validation of correct template usage during import
test_cases.Dataset: Original CdG file (not the system template).
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the import and displays a clear error message about using the correct template.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Displays Imported Data with Correct Month and Year

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT system.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Dashboard - Single PoS - 'Business Data' tab for a PoS included in a successful import.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Business Data' tab is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the imported Collection, Revenues, and Fees data are displayed for the correct month and year.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the imported data with the correct month and year of reference.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'ADI Data' tab for the same PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: 'ADI Data' tab is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the imported data is also reflected in the 'ADI Data' tab for the correct month and year.
Steps.Expected Result: 'ADI Data' tab displays the imported data with the correct month and year of reference.

test_cases.Reference System: Import Profit and Loss - Gaming Hall
test_cases.Preconditions: A successful import of valid data has been performed for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: Previously imported valid data for a PoS, including month and year.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the imported data for the correct PoS, month, and year in both 'Business Data' and 'ADI Data' tabs.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of Valid P&L Corner Excel File

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Profit and Loss - Corner' option.
Steps.Expected Result: Import interface for P&L Corner is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Upload' button and select a valid Excel file that follows the required template, including correct month and year of reference, and valid PoS data.
Steps.Expected Result: File is selected and ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Submit the file for import.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and displays a success message indicating the import was successful.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Business Data' and 'ADI Data' tabs for a PoS included in the import.
Steps.Expected Result: Imported Collection, Revenues, and Fees data for the selected PoS are correctly displayed, including the correct month and year of reference.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the ZENIT system and the 'Massive Importer' section. The Excel template is correctly filled with valid data, including month and year of reference.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid Excel file with correct structure, PoS data, and reference month/year.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system successfully imports the data, updates the relevant PoS records, and displays the correct information on the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of QR Corner Data via Excel Template

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the option '*Import "QR Corner"*'.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload dialog for QR Corner import is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Browse' and select a correctly filled Excel template containing valid PoS data (including 'Zona Rice' as reference key and 'Date Activated' for channel 1).
Steps.Expected Result: File is selected and ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Upload' to import the file.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file and displays a success message indicating that the data has been imported successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Master Data' tab for a PoS included in the import.
Steps.Expected Result: Imported 'Date Activated' and related data are visible and correctly updated for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the ZENIT system and the correct Excel template filled with valid PoS data.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Correctly filled Excel template with PoS data including 'Zona Rice' and 'Date Activated'.
test_cases.Expected Result: QR Corner data is successfully imported and visible in the Master Data tab for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of Offline PoS Data via Massive Importer

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Offline PoS Data Storage' option.
Steps.Expected Result: The import interface for Offline PoS Data Storage is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Download the provided Excel template for Offline PoS data (if not already available).
Steps.Expected Result: Excel template is downloaded successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Fill the template with valid historical PoS data, ensuring all required fields (including ID Rice and Zona Rice) are completed.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is correctly filled with valid data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the completed Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and displays a success message if validation passes.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS' and search for one of the imported PoS using ID Rice and Zona Rice.
Steps.Expected Result: Imported PoS data is visible and matches the uploaded information.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit with permissions to use the Massive Importer. Excel template is available. Test PoS data is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid Excel file with at least one historical PoS entry (including ID Rice and Zona Rice).
test_cases.Expected Result: Offline PoS data is successfully imported, stored, and visible in the Dashboard for each PoS. No errors occur during the process.

test_cases.Title: Import Fails with Missing Required Fields in Excel

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section and select 'Import Offline PoS Data Storage'.
Steps.Expected Result: Import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file with one or more PoS entries missing required fields (e.g., missing ID Rice or Zona Rice).
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is prepared with missing required data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the incomplete Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and displays an error message indicating missing required fields. Import is rejected.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit. Excel template is available. Test data with missing required fields is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with at least one PoS entry missing ID Rice or Zona Rice.
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the import and displays a clear error message about missing required fields. No data is imported.

test_cases.Title: Update Existing Offline PoS Data via Re-Import

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit application.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Massive Importer' and select 'Import Offline PoS Data Storage'.
Steps.Expected Result: Import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Upload an Excel file with a PoS entry (using a specific ID Rice and Zona Rice) and complete the import.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS data is imported successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Modify the same PoS entry in the Excel file (e.g., change a field value such as legal status or loss transition).
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is updated with new data for the same PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Re-upload the modified Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates and updates the existing PoS data in Zenit.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Dashboard - Single PoS' and search for the updated PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the updated data for the PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit. Initial PoS data has been imported. Modified data is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with existing PoS entry, then modified and re-uploaded.
test_cases.Expected Result: Existing PoS data is updated in Zenit according to the new import. Changes are reflected in the Dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Ensure Write-off Applied Flag Data is Stored but Not Displayed

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Zenit and navigate to 'Massive Importer'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and import interface is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file with a PoS entry including the 'Write-off applied Flag' field set to a specific value.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is prepared with the Write-off applied Flag populated.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates and imports the data successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Dashboard - Single PoS' and search for the imported PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS data is visible, but the Write-off applied Flag is not displayed on the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Query the backend database or use an admin interface to verify that the Write-off applied Flag value is stored for the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Write-off applied Flag is present and correctly stored in the backend, despite not being visible on the Dashboard.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit and backend/admin tools. Excel file with Write-off applied Flag is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with Write-off applied Flag set for at least one PoS entry.
test_cases.Expected Result: Write-off applied Flag is stored in the system but not displayed on the Dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Reject Import if Excel File Contains PoS Already in MDM System

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Zenit and access 'Massive Importer'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and import interface is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file with a PoS entry that is already present in the MDM system.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is prepared with duplicate PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and rejects the import, displaying an error message indicating that the PoS already exists in MDM.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit. MDM system contains at least one PoS. Excel file with duplicate PoS is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with PoS entry matching an existing MDM PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the import and provides a clear error message for PoS already present in MDM. No duplicate data is imported.

test_cases.Title: Import Fails with Invalid Excel File Format

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Zenit and access 'Massive Importer'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and import interface is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload a file that is not in the required Excel format (e.g., CSV, TXT, or corrupted Excel file).
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and rejects it, displaying an error message about invalid file format.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit. Invalid file is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid file (e.g., CSV, TXT, or corrupted Excel).
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an appropriate error message. No data is imported.

test_cases.Title: Ensure No Automatic Acquisition of Personal Data from Other Systems During Import

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Zenit and access 'Massive Importer'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and import interface is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file with PoS entries, intentionally omitting some personal data fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is prepared with missing personal data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the Excel file via the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and either rejects the import due to missing personal data or imports only the provided data without supplementing from other systems.

Steps.Step Description: Verify in the Dashboard and backend that no additional personal data has been acquired from external systems for the imported PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Only the data provided in the Excel file is present for the imported PoS. No automatic data acquisition from other systems occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to Zenit. Excel file with missing personal data is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with PoS entries missing some personal data fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: No personal data is acquired from other systems; only data from the uploaded file is present for imported PoS.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of Valid AWP Altro Concessionario Excel File

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import AWP - Altro Concessionario' option.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload interface for 'Import AWP - Altro Concessionario' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Download Template' button to obtain the standard Excel template.
Steps.Expected Result: Standard Excel template is downloaded successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Fill the template with valid AWP data, ensuring each record corresponds to an AWP and 'Zona Rice' is correctly populated for each PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel template is correctly filled with valid data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the completed Excel template using the provided interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the file and begins validation.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the import process to complete.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms successful import and updates the information for each PoS using 'Zona Rice' as the reference key.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - ADI Data' tab for a PoS included in the import.
Steps.Expected Result: Imported AWP data is visible and correctly reflects the number of AWPs for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials and access to the 'Massive Importer' section. The standard Excel template is available. Test PoS exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; valid, correctly filled Excel template with at least two PoS and multiple AWP records.
test_cases.Expected Result: AWP data is imported successfully, and the Dashboard displays the correct number of AWPs per PoS.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Handles Large Excel Files (Performance Test)

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged into the ZENIT system.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Conti Gioco Credit Situation' option.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload interface for 'Conti Gioco Credit Situation' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on 'Choose File' and select a valid Excel file with a large number of PoS records (e.g., 10,000+ rows).
Steps.Expected Result: Selected file is attached for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Upload' button to start the import process.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file within acceptable time limits and displays a success message.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to ZENIT system and a large valid Excel file is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Large Excel file (10,000+ rows).
test_cases.Expected Result: The system successfully imports large files within acceptable performance thresholds without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Performance aspects only; does not cover functional correctness of all records.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of SIMP Credit Situation via Excel Template

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import SIMP Credit Situation' option.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Import SIMP Credit Situation' upload interface is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Choose File' and select a valid Excel file structured according to the SIMP Credit Management template, containing correct data for multiple PoS (with valid IdRice and Zona Rice).
Steps.Expected Result: File is selected and ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Upload' button to start the import process.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file and displays a success message indicating that the import was successful.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for one of the imported PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Imported SIMP Credit Situation data is correctly displayed for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to ZENIT system and a valid Excel template file with correct SIMP Credit Situation data is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Valid Excel template file with correct data for at least two PoS (including IdRice and Zona Rice).
test_cases.Expected Result: SIMP Credit Situation data is successfully imported and visible in the dashboard for each PoS.

test_cases.Title: Import Fails with Invalid Excel Template Structure

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import SIMP Credit Situation' option.
Steps.Expected Result: Upload interface is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Choose File' and select an Excel file that does not conform to the required SIMP Credit Management template structure (e.g., missing columns, incorrect headers).
Steps.Expected Result: File is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Upload' button.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating invalid template structure.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to ZENIT system and an invalid Excel file is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Invalid Excel file (e.g., missing required columns or incorrect headers).
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents import and displays a clear error message about the invalid template structure.

test_cases.Title: Successful Import of Valid Cerved Data Excel File

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Cerved Data' option.
Steps.Expected Result: The import interface for Cerved Data is displayed, allowing file upload.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Upload' button and select a valid Excel file structured according to the Cerved Data template (e.g., CervedDataTemplate.xlsx) containing correct data for multiple PoS with valid VAT numbers or Tax Codes.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS' and search for a PoS included in the imported file.
Steps.Expected Result: The PoS details are displayed, and the imported Cerved Data is visible and correctly updated.
