test_cases.Functionality: Import Cerved Data via Excel template
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Valid Cerved Data Excel template with correct data for multiple PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: Cerved Data is successfully imported and visible for each PoS in the dashboard. No errors are reported.

test_cases.Title: Verify Successful Execution of Back-End Procedure with Valid Input

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a valid input payload as per the back-end procedure specification.
Steps.Expected Result: Input payload is ready and meets all required schema and data constraints.

Steps.Step Description: Send the input payload to the back-end procedure endpoint via the appropriate API call (e.g., HTTP POST).
Steps.Expected Result: Request is successfully sent to the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the response returned by the back-end procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: Response is received without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the response contains the expected output data and status code (e.g., HTTP 200 OK).
Steps.Expected Result: Response data matches the expected output and status code indicates success.

test_cases.Preconditions: Back-end service is deployed and accessible. Valid authentication credentials are available if required.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid input payload as per procedure specification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Back-end procedure executes successfully and returns the correct output for valid input.

test_cases.Title: Verify Back-End Procedure Handles Invalid Input Gracefully

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an invalid input payload (e.g., missing required fields, incorrect data types).
Steps.Expected Result: Invalid input payload is ready.

Steps.Step Description: Send the invalid input payload to the back-end procedure endpoint via the appropriate API call.
Steps.Expected Result: Request is sent to the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the response returned by the back-end procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: Response is received from the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the response contains an appropriate error message and status code (e.g., HTTP 400 Bad Request).
Steps.Expected Result: Error message and status code correctly indicate the nature of the input error.

test_cases.Preconditions: Back-end service is deployed and accessible. Valid authentication credentials are available if required.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid input payloads (e.g., missing fields, wrong data types).
test_cases.Expected Result: Back-end procedure returns a clear error message and appropriate status code for invalid input.

test_cases.Title: Verify Back-End Procedure Handles System Errors Gracefully

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a system error (e.g., database unavailable, internal exception) during back-end procedure execution.
Steps.Expected Result: System error condition is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Send a valid input payload to the back-end procedure endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: Request is sent to the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the response returned by the back-end procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: Response is received from the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the response contains an appropriate error message and status code (e.g., HTTP 500 Internal Server Error).
Steps.Expected Result: Error message and status code correctly indicate a system error.

test_cases.Preconditions: Back-end service is deployed and accessible. Mechanism to simulate system errors is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid input payload; system error simulation setup.
test_cases.Expected Result: Back-end procedure returns a clear error message and appropriate status code for system errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Back-End Procedure Logging for Audit and Debugging

Steps.Step Description: Send a valid input payload to the back-end procedure endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: Request is sent and processed by the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Access the back-end system logs after execution.
Steps.Expected Result: System logs are accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the logs contain entries for the request, including input data, execution status, and any errors if applicable.
Steps.Expected Result: Logs contain accurate and complete information for the request.

test_cases.Preconditions: Back-end service is deployed and accessible. Tester has access to system logs.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid input payload.
test_cases.Expected Result: Back-end procedure logs all relevant information for audit and debugging purposes.

test_cases.Title: Verify Back-End Procedure Performance Under Load

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a set of valid input payloads for concurrent execution.
Steps.Expected Result: Multiple valid input payloads are ready.

Steps.Step Description: Send multiple concurrent requests to the back-end procedure endpoint (e.g., using a load testing tool).
Steps.Expected Result: Concurrent requests are sent to the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the response times and system resource usage during the test.
Steps.Expected Result: Performance metrics are collected.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the back-end procedure meets the defined performance criteria (e.g., response time, throughput).
Steps.Expected Result: Back-end procedure performs within acceptable limits under load.

test_cases.Preconditions: Back-end service is deployed and accessible. Load testing tools are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple valid input payloads.
test_cases.Expected Result: Back-end procedure maintains acceptable performance under load conditions.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Nightly Snapshot Scheduling and Execution

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system date and time is set to a typical operational day.
Steps.Expected Result: System clock is set correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the scheduled nightly snapshot time to occur.
Steps.Expected Result: System triggers the daily snapshot process at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the snapshot process for completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Snapshot process completes without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a new data archive is created for the current date.
Steps.Expected Result: A new archive file/folder is present, labeled with the correct date and time.

test_cases.Preconditions: System is operational; snapshot schedule is configured; test environment contains sample PoS data.
test_cases.Functionality: Daily data snapshot scheduling and execution
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data; system clock set to current date.
test_cases.Expected Result: A daily snapshot is automatically created at the scheduled time, labeled with the correct date and time, and contains the expected data.

test_cases.Title: Verify Deletion of Closed PoS Data After Configurable Retention Period

Steps.Step Description: Identify PoS records marked as closed and not under legal management or with recent loss transitions.
Steps.Expected Result: Closed PoS records are identified according to criteria.

Steps.Step Description: Set the system retention period to 10 years (or another configurable value).
Steps.Expected Result: Retention period is set successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate passage of time so that some closed PoS records exceed the retention period.
Steps.Expected Result: Some PoS records are now eligible for deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the nightly archiving process.
Steps.Expected Result: Archiving process runs as scheduled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that eligible closed PoS records are deleted from the archive.
Steps.Expected Result: Only PoS records exceeding the retention period and not under exceptions are deleted.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that PoS under legal management or with recent loss transitions are retained.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS records under exception criteria are not deleted.

test_cases.Preconditions: System contains PoS records with various statuses and closure dates; retention period is configurable.
test_cases.Functionality: Retention policy enforcement for PoS data
test_cases.Dataset: PoS records with different closure dates, statuses, and exception flags.
test_cases.Expected Result: Closed PoS data not under exception and exceeding the retention period are deleted; exception PoS are retained.

test_cases.Title: Verify Temporary Logical Closure of PoS and Delayed Permanent Deletion

Steps.Step Description: Mark a PoS as closed and configure a temporary logical closure period (e.g., 30 days).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is marked as logically closed and not visible in standard queries.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the logically closed PoS during the closure period.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is not displayed or accessible to users.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate passage of the logical closure period (e.g., 30 days).
Steps.Expected Result: Logical closure period expires.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the archiving process after the logical closure period.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes PoS for permanent deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the PoS is permanently deleted after the logical closure period.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is no longer present in the archive or retrievable.

test_cases.Preconditions: System supports logical closure; PoS records exist for testing; logical closure period is configurable.
test_cases.Functionality: Temporary logical closure and delayed deletion of PoS
test_cases.Dataset: PoS records eligible for logical closure; closure period configuration.
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS is hidden during logical closure and permanently deleted after the period expires.

test_cases.Title: Verify Continuous and Complete Data Storage Without Interruptions

Steps.Step Description: Review archive logs and storage for a defined period (e.g., 30 consecutive days).
Steps.Expected Result: Archive entries exist for each day in the period.

Steps.Step Description: Check that each daily archive is labeled with the correct date and time.
Steps.Expected Result: Each archive is correctly timestamped.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no days are missing from the archive sequence.
Steps.Expected Result: No gaps in daily archiving; all days are present.

test_cases.Preconditions: System has been running and archiving for at least 30 days; access to archive logs and storage.
test_cases.Functionality: Continuous daily data storage and labeling
test_cases.Dataset: Archive logs and storage files for at least 30 days.
test_cases.Expected Result: Data is archived daily without interruption, each labeled with date and time, and no days are missing.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Storage Content and Archiving Type per External Specification

Steps.Step Description: Obtain the external file 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati V04.1.xlsx' specifying data to be archived and archiving type.
Steps.Expected Result: Specification file is available and readable.

Steps.Step Description: For each data point listed as 'daily' in the file, verify it is present in the daily archive.
Steps.Expected Result: All required daily data points are present in the archive.

Steps.Step Description: For data points listed as 'weekly' or 'monthly', verify they are archived at the correct frequency.
Steps.Expected Result: Weekly/monthly data points are present at correct intervals.

test_cases.Preconditions: Access to the external specification file; system has archived data for at least one week and one month.
test_cases.Functionality: Data content and archiving frequency compliance
test_cases.Dataset: ZENIT - Elenco Dati V04.1.xlsx; archived data for multiple periods.
test_cases.Expected Result: Archived data matches the external specification for content and frequency.

test_cases.Title: Verify Retrieval and Analysis of Historical Data for Any Daily Storage

Steps.Step Description: Access the system's historical data retrieval interface or API.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical data retrieval interface/API is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Request data for a specific date from the archive.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns the correct data for the requested date.

Steps.Step Description: Request data for a range of dates (e.g., last 7 days).
Steps.Expected Result: System returns data for all requested dates.

Steps.Step Description: Perform analysis or reporting on the retrieved data.
Steps.Expected Result: Analysis/reporting functions operate correctly on historical data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Archived data exists for multiple dates; access to retrieval interface/API.
test_cases.Dataset: Archived data for multiple dates; access credentials for retrieval interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: Historical data can be retrieved and analyzed for any archived day or period.

test_cases.Title: Verify Efficient Storage and System Performance During Archiving

Steps.Step Description: Monitor system resource usage (CPU, memory, disk I/O) during the nightly archiving process.
Steps.Expected Result: Resource usage remains within acceptable limits.

Steps.Step Description: Measure the time taken to complete the archiving process for a typical data volume.
Steps.Expected Result: Archiving completes within the expected time frame.

Steps.Step Description: Increase data volume to simulate high-load conditions and repeat archiving.
Steps.Expected Result: System maintains performance and does not degrade significantly.

test_cases.Preconditions: System monitoring tools are available; test environment can simulate varying data volumes.
test_cases.Functionality: Efficient storage and performance under load
test_cases.Dataset: Test data sets of varying sizes; monitoring tools.
test_cases.Expected Result: System stores data efficiently and maintains optimal performance even under increased load.

test_cases.Title: Verify Scalability for Large Volumes and Easy Retrieval of Daily Storage

Steps.Step Description: Populate the system with a large volume of PoS data (e.g., simulate several years of daily archives).
Steps.Expected Result: System contains a large historical data set.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to retrieve daily storage for random dates across the data set.
Steps.Expected Result: System retrieves data quickly and accurately for any date.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor system response times and resource usage during retrieval.
Steps.Expected Result: Response times remain within acceptable limits and system remains stable.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test environment supports large data volumes; tools available to measure response times.
test_cases.Dataset: Large historical data set (simulated or real); monitoring tools.
test_cases.Expected Result: System scales to handle large data volumes and allows easy, fast retrieval of any daily storage.

test_cases.Title: Verify MDM PoS Master Data Integration via Web Services (Near Real Time)

Steps.Step Description: Trigger an update of PoS Master Data in the MDM system.
Steps.Expected Result: MDM system processes the update and exposes the new data via its Web Service interface.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a request from the consuming application to fetch PoS Master Data via the MDM Web Service.
Steps.Expected Result: Consuming application successfully connects to the MDM Web Service.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the returned PoS Master Data reflects the recent update and is received within the expected near real-time window (e.g., < 1 minute).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS Master Data is accurate, up-to-date, and delivered within the near real-time SLA.

test_cases.Preconditions: MDM system is operational and accessible; consuming application is configured to connect to MDM Web Service; test PoS data available.
test_cases.Dataset: Test PoS Master Data record (e.g., PoS ID: 12345, Name: Test Store)
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS Master Data is synchronized between MDM and consuming application in near real time via Web Services.

test_cases.Title: Validate CERVED Data and Report Retrieval (Daily/On Demand) via Web Services

Steps.Step Description: Schedule a daily data retrieval job from CERVED via Web Services.
Steps.Expected Result: Job is scheduled and executes at the configured time.

Steps.Step Description: Manually trigger an on-demand request for CERVED Data and Report via Web Services.
Steps.Expected Result: On-demand request is accepted and processed by the CERVED service.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the data and report returned match the expected format and content as per CERVED specifications.
Steps.Expected Result: Data and report are complete, accurate, and in the correct format.

test_cases.Preconditions: CERVED Web Service is available; test credentials and access rights are configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample CERVED Data and Report request parameters (e.g., Company ID: 67890)
test_cases.Expected Result: CERVED Data and Reports are retrievable both on a scheduled (daily) and on-demand basis via Web Services.

test_cases.Title: Check GEO Credit Lines Situation Data Synchronization via Database (Near Real Time)

Steps.Step Description: Update a credit line situation in the GEO source system.
Steps.Expected Result: GEO system updates the credit line situation and commits the change to the database.

Steps.Step Description: Query the integrated database for the updated credit line situation record.
Steps.Expected Result: Database returns the updated credit line situation reflecting the recent change.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the update is available in the database within the near real-time window (e.g., < 1 minute).
Steps.Expected Result: Data is synchronized and available in near real time.

test_cases.Preconditions: GEO system and database are operational; test credit line data is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Test Credit Line record (e.g., Credit Line ID: 24680, Status: Active)
test_cases.Expected Result: Credit Lines Situation data is synchronized in near real time between GEO and the integrated database.

test_cases.Title: Verify SAP 'Unpaids' Data Integration via Web Services (Near Real Time)

Steps.Step Description: Create or update an 'Unpaids' record in SAP.
Steps.Expected Result: SAP system processes the new or updated 'Unpaids' record.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the integration process to fetch 'Unpaids' data from SAP via Web Services.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration process connects to SAP Web Service and requests 'Unpaids' data.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the 'Unpaids' data received matches the SAP record and is delivered within the near real-time window.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Unpaids' data is accurate and delivered within the expected SLA.

test_cases.Preconditions: SAP system is operational; integration endpoint is configured; test 'Unpaids' data is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Test 'Unpaids' record (e.g., Invoice ID: 54321, Amount: 1000 EUR)
test_cases.Expected Result: 'Unpaids' data is synchronized in near real time between SAP and the consuming application via Web Services.

test_cases.Title: Validate VALORIZZATORE Border Data Integration (Weekly/Bi-Weekly) via Web Services

Steps.Step Description: Schedule a weekly or bi-weekly job to retrieve Border Data from VALORIZZATORE via Web Services.
Steps.Expected Result: Job is scheduled and executes at the configured interval.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Border Data is received and matches the expected format and content.
Steps.Expected Result: Border Data is complete, accurate, and in the correct format.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the data is available according to the scheduled frequency (weekly/bi-weekly).
Steps.Expected Result: Data is available as per the defined schedule.

test_cases.Preconditions: VALORIZZATORE Web Service is available; scheduling system is operational.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample Border Data request parameters (e.g., Date Range: last 2 weeks)
test_cases.Expected Result: Border Data is integrated from VALORIZZATORE according to the scheduled frequency via Web Services.

test_cases.Title: Verify Error Handling for Unavailable Integration Service (e.g., CERVED Web Service Down)

Steps.Step Description: Simulate the unavailability of the CERVED Web Service (e.g., by disabling the endpoint or using a mock service that returns errors).
Steps.Expected Result: Integration system attempts to connect and receives an error response.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a data retrieval request from the integration system to the unavailable CERVED Web Service.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration system handles the error gracefully (e.g., logs the error, retries if configured, notifies the user/system admin as per requirements).

Steps.Step Description: Check system logs and notifications for appropriate error messages and handling actions.
Steps.Expected Result: Error is logged, and notification is sent as per the error handling policy.

test_cases.Preconditions: Integration system is operational; CERVED Web Service endpoint is made unavailable for the test.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (service unavailability simulated)
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles integration service unavailability gracefully, logs the error, and notifies as required.
